description:
Too many good things to say about this neighborhood sports bar. 

Great staff.

Solid food. (Yankee burger medium add bacon, chicken sando, loco moco and eggs benedict on the weekends)

Nice outside patio.

Rotating beers on tap and nicely priced beer and shot specials.

Plus over 100 years of history. Whats not to love!
author: Ryan W.

description:
I am giving this place five stars due to the friendly and approachable staff who catered to my every whim.

My daughter was attending a concert at the Bottom of the Hill Club so we stopped by this place for a pre-show snack.  If you've ever been in this particular part of San Francisco then you know it's not exactly packed with places to eat.

Right away, I was drawn in by the sports pub ambiance;  warm, friendly, full of locals, tattered memorabilia, a pool table, and teeny tiny restrooms.   It was a definite working class feel- empty Hamm's cans and all.

The food was nothing foo-foo or exotic; just your typical bar food served fast and hot.  I had the Italian dip, vinegar and salt fries, and a half pint of Belgian style ale.  Very tasty and filling.  

The wait staff seem to genuinely enjoy working with one another (or else they are just good at faking it) and that contributed a lot to the convivial atmosphere.  When I am back in Potrero Hill, I will definitely stop in again.
author: Tammy D.

description:
What's not to like? It's like two spots in one. Stay inside for a pub - sports bar feel. Head outside for fresh air, sometimes a quiet corner, and maybe a little people watching.

Great tap and bottle selection. Love the food! Had tofu tacos, a little salty, but overall really good, also shared the beet wrap, absolutely delicious.Two beers and two good-great meals w/tip for $40, you can't go wrong. Also can't think of another pub that does food this good, and has so many veggie options.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: I heard that Connecticut Yankee is the Boston Sports Bar in San Francisco, so being a life long Red Sox fan I had to check it out. Since it's just blocks away from daughter K apartment and were early for the Giants game I decided to pre game and get some drinks. The bar was full but managed to get the last barstool at the end of the bar. The bartender quickly took my order of Crown Royal and a bowl of New England Clam Chowder. There are tons of beer specials and it's dog friendly. Their clam chowder is good with lots of clams. The bar is a nice friendly vibe and a long history of being a drinking establishment in San Francisco which is documented on the back of their menu. Being a part of Red Sox nation and them having the best record in the MLB this year, it was important for me to find a Boston sports bar to watch the 2018 playoff run.
author: George F.

description:
Connecticut Yankee is one of my San Francisco staples! I have so many favorites here so I'll just get into it.

First is probably the green chile mac--add some hot sauce to it and it's that perfect combination of cheesy/creamy and spicy goodness. I also love their entire brunch menu. Particularly, they used to have this breakfast bowl thing where it would come with fresh fruit and homemade cinnamon toast crunch croutons! Honestly, that dish made me fall in love with brunch as a concept. Their breakfast sandwiches are great too, and I don't even usually like sausage. In terms of cocktails, I like their Irish coffee. Last time I ordered it, it came with actual coffee ice cubes, which I thought was a nice touch.
author: Claire C.

description: Ate here before really good food!! Not today I walk in waited for about 15-20 mins no one   approached us even made eye contact with the  bar people a few times still nothing. they wasn't busy but they was busy enough getting drunk together or smoking outside so I just left maybe I'll try again some other time!
author: Sal C.

description:
A bit pricey for what you get (smallish serving sizes), but the food is pretty good. I mainly love the atmosphere and the patio server (who is always on top of his game and super attentive). 

You get to seat yourself inside or outside. The patio has 1 TV screen and 3 heaters but it doesn't do much to help warm up the place on a cold day. However, it is less noisy outside and rather intimate while the inside is your typical bar scene with several tables/booths. I don't really drink but I definitely love coming here for a quick bite.

Foods I recommend:
fried Chicken burger
spinach artichoke dip
any of their fries--so soft and crispy at the same time; my favorite

Foods that were not that great:
beet wrap 

Foods that were alright:
corned beef sandwich (lots onion and jalepeno)
author: Lydia Z.

description: I've been coming here for weekend afternoon drinks and love the outdoor seating! Service has been great (guessing since they're not as busy) and I'm a big fan of their gin gimlets, salt and vinegar fries, and popcorn!
author: Stacy K.

description:
3.5 stars, rounded up.

Came here for a team lunch, and we sat in the outdoor patio area. Not sure I'm into the vibe indoors since it's a sports bar, and it seems and feels very dated (too dark for my liking), but the heated outdoor patio was very lovely! I ordered the bim-bop burger, which I thought was pretty good. The cook on the patty was medium per my request, but it lacked flavor... It was quite bland to be honest. My burger also didn't come on a sesame seed bun which is what the description stated, but it was fine. The fries were good though, and overall I enjoyed the meal. Good atmosphere, decent bar food. It lacked the wow factor, but I would come back again on a sunny day to try the other dishes. Also, the servers were all very friendly!
author: Angela C.

description:
yep, "The" Place to watch a game

The energy of this place is so addictive. I came here for the super bowl and survived the entire game standing (which was fine). They have an outdoor patio with string lights. 

The service is top notch. Food - chicken wings, fries, and other finger food was great. 

Cant wait for the next game
author: Subha J.

description: Fun sports Pats bar. Food is yummy as well. Service a little slow at times on a busy day. I'd go back for Pats games. GO NINERS !! :)
author: Stephanie A.

description: Awesome spot!  Incredibly friendly service, food is fantastic since they redid the menu.  Don't love the Patriots fans - but hey, just avoid game night :-P
author: Wojtek K.

description: The fries are a must try!  Garlic or Salt & Vinegar, both are amazing!  Barkeep Jason is friendly and accommodating, you are lucky to have service like that on your team.  Don't miss the chicken sandwich either... must try if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Highly recommend ordering the Bim Bop burger - got it medium rare on a sesame seed bun, with kimchi aioli, a fried egg, and crispy-meaty fries. One of the best burgers I've had in a while. It looked so delectable I dug in right away and missed a photo opp. 

Pair it with their golden state cider! It's crisp and refreshing, with just enough sweetness.
author: Camille E.

description: Perfect low key neighborhood sports bar. Food is surprisingly good, the staff is amazingly friendly and attentive, and it's even kids friendly... We just moved to Potrero and we are there much more often than any of the restaurants on 18th, which are much closer for us. U gotta love the yankee.
author: Gilles D.

description:
Restaurant and outdoor patio(open all the time) is dog friendly, which is a plus!

Service was friendly and all the servers were laid back. 

Good selection of beers and standard bar food, I didn't find anything mind blowing but good enough for noshing with some beers. Clam chowder tasted garlicky. Fried chicken sando was okay, but wish it had more chicken to bread/bun ratio. I wish they served tots here or more fried appetizers. They seem to have good food reviews, so i'll have to try some other things next time.

Decor is baseball themed, kind of divey but nice and clean enough. Not too crowded either and more importantly no blasting music.

Overall, fairly solid place, like 3.5 stars but will round up for the neighborhood! Wouldn't come here for the food alone but it seems like a chill place to drink and grab food with the dog. I'll be back Connecticut yankee!
author: Stephanie K.

description: Excellent service, delicious food, great selection. All around great spot. Glad it's here for when I go to shows at Bottom of the Hill. SO GOOD.
author: Sandra J.

description:
This is out go to spot for a quick drink or when it's a nice day out and you're on the hunt for a patio to have drinks on. 

What makes this a 5 star for me is the food. You're thinking, how can bar food be 5 stars? We'll they don't just have normal bar food. This food is bomb as we used to say back in the day.
author: Leina K.

description:
So I've only come here for the food and I just get the sense that food is not really their thing.  The ingredient quality is good but there's usually one thing that's unnecessary or incongruous. Why would you put chorizo in steamed mussels?  Why would you make a very vaguely Southwestern version of mac and cheese with anemic chilis?

Also, how does a $14 fig and prosciutto salad have only two figs in it? At least grill them!  The salad was quite small and the prosciutto was slimy/lumpy because it hadn't been fully sliced.  The whole shebang just wasn't close to being worth the price.

I will say that the bar itself seems like a fun place for dudely-dudes and game ladies to drink beers, watch of the sports, and chill.
author: Joe B.

description: Tyler was really cool. He put the Giants Cowboys game on in the back even though the bar only plays Bostons sports on the speakers. Really accommodating. Awesome guy/bartender. Awesome spot. (Let's Go Yankees!)
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Loved the outdoor patio area-- especially if the weather's good! You can bring your fur baby here too.

Their BLT salad is awesome -- I was skeptical because it didn't seem like a salad place... but the salad was great. Got the dressing on the side, as other reviewers mentioned there was a lot of dressing at times.

Other folks in the party got the Shashuka and the mac and cheese -- both were enjoyed. Started off with the salt and vinegar fries, yum!

Pretty good beer list, and FYI they don't serve ribs till 3pm on weekeends (it's the brunch menu before hand).
author: Alison L.

description:
This review is primarily about the food.

I've been coming here for about 20 years, and always appreciated this place as a little slice of Boston beer and sports culture in Potrero Hill.  The bartenders were grouchy, the tables a bit sticky, and the food was good bar food.  The outdoor seating area was a great place to enjoy the sunniest neighborhood in San Francisco.

A few years ago they revamped the menu (and perhaps ownership), and I am continuously amazed at how delicious every item I've had there is, time after time.  The chef and cooking staff clearly care about every little bite and detail, from garnish to main dish.  The items range from the classic burgers they've always had (though updated) to newer things like Tofu tacos - and every recipe reflects that same attention to detail.  My go-to is the fried chicken sandwich, though the Goddess Salad with chicken is also great.

This place is worth not only a visit but also a regular patronage.  Sunday early dinners with the family or weeknights for a beer and burger.  It's a great place.
author: Rob P.

description: I walk in, immediately feelin like Carlton Fisk in '75 waving myself fair after a long night of crushing bud latte's. Order a cup a chowdah and a pbr, get served quicker than Dave Roberts goin 1st to 2nd in '04. End up spendin the whole day there, must a tried half the menu Mo Vaughn style and it was all as good as his '96 season. Overall great service, food, and atmosphere, I give it 5 stahs in honor of Nomar Garciaparra. Don't ask me where I pahked my cah I took the T.
author: Carl B.

description:
We came here for after dinner drinks and it was rather lively. They had a karaoke stage so it got a bit rowdy and noisy. Pool table in back, and also a patio area on the side. They mostly have a lot of brews on tap, but I'm more of a vodka or whiskey drinker so I stuck with that. 

What made me give 4 stars to this place was the cool bartender. I didn't get his name but he was a tall, built guy working on the Saturday night before Halloween (last night). So I was waiting at the bar to put in my drink order, and when he came my way, this dude next to me shouted his order to the bartender. Well, since I was there first, he shut the guy down and took my order first. Well done, sir. I applaud and thank you for your chivalry.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Service: awesome. Everyone was so nice

Food: everyone got the burger except me and they loved it. I had the clam chowder and the burrata salad and both were good. 

Drinks: lots of great beer selection. I'm a sucker for the spurs and they had some really good ones. 

Great for groups!
author: Laura D.

description:
In retrospect, probably shouldn't have come in wearing a Dolphins hat.

I was visiting friends in their new place in Potrero Hill and the bus drops you off right outside Connecticut Yankee. Just from the outside I was impressed - while it looked like a great neighborhood bar, the outdoor patio was gorgeous. My friends definitely had a solid neighborhood spot.

So after some hanging out and day drinking, we decided to hit it up. I got some flack for my hat but no sense that they messed with me or my food. They have the bar in the front, plenty of table seating for groups or families, even a pool table in the back. The loud guests and New England memorabilia made me know this was a legit Boston Bar. 

Speaking of the bar, they have a solid beer selection as well as cocktails. They also let you sample before ordering. I ended up getting an Imperial Red, but they had lighter beers like a gose, and darker to a stout. 

Next up is the rotating menu - some items have changed with the relatively new owners, the Pour Guys. A lot sounds delicious and I went with some basics:

New England Clam Chowder - while not as thick as my preference, the soup was flavorful but best about it was the amount of clams! Nearly every spoonful came out full of clams. Can't beat that!

Yankee Burger - after all the drinking, needed some protein. While I love a provolone burger, the bacon leek fixing sounded awesome, as did the aioli. I got mine Rare but next time would go medium rare, but the burger was juicy and full of flavor. The plentiful fries sopped up much of the juice.

I would gladly come back, but probably not during football Sundays.
author: Michael C.

description: Everything about the Connecticut Yankee is fantastic. I'm sad that, in my brief fore of thirteen years in this fine San Pancho, that I have only frequented this fine establishment all but three times. Last night I went there to watch a playoff game with some friends and was treated like a regular upon stepping through the door (wow, i says) and our waitress was amazing. The way in which all of the staff work together is inspiring. They know exactly what they're doing and yet still manage to keep all the surliness in line. The food is fantastic (this was my first time eatin it) and that red wine sour ale is reason enough for me to hightail it back there asap! Mad props, all around. Thanks to everyone for treating us so well.
author: Sarah N.

description:
Good food. Great neighborhood bar atmosphere and great place to watch a game. Beer taps are great local favorites (think Anchor Steam who is a block away and Speakeasy that's also nearby - oh wait, new owners dropped them :(

This place is a piece of history. If the food was a little better, I'd give them a 5 star
author: Darin A.

description:
Connecticut Yankee: 5 stars
Niya: 37 stars 
So, like, 21 stars, average. 
And Yelp says my review is too short, which is pretty judgement, so I'm adding more words. Like these.
author: Bernard W.

description: A great de facto spot for lunch! The food is always good, the service is spot on and quick, and the space is lighthearted and open, especially the outdoor area. I typically default to the BimBop burger because I know it's great. Fantastic spot for lunch or to grab a quick bite with coworkers/friends.
author: Kraig L.

description: The Yankee is my go to. It's convenient, not too expensive, and they have a lovely patio. Their salt and vinegar fries are amazing, their burger is great, and their spaghetti is pretty tasty. I would skip the caesar - it's mediocre compared to the rest of the food. Wings are great too!
author: Christina S.

description: Johnny is the best bartender this side of the Mississippi!!!!!!! Great customer service, drinks and spirit!!!!!
author: KT D.

description: I found myself in the Connecticut Yankee on a warm (by San Francisco standards) Sunday evening in October where a group of us were watching the baseball on a silent TV in the beer garden. People arrived at different times, ordering food at different intervals but they coped well and weren't too put out. The food looked good but I didn't have any so can only comment on the beer, which was ok. According to folks this is a good place to watch the Red Sox, which I would second having seen all the New England gear on the wall.
author: Matt B.

description: Came to watch the World Cup finals and had to give some special kudos. Some of the best bar food I've had, including fresh ingredients for the salad and yummy croissant and jam. The service was also friendly, timely, and attentive even with a full house. I'll definitely be back
author: Lisa A.

description: Markets itself as a Boston bar as a gimmick.  What kind of Boston Bar favors the Warriors over the Bruins?  This is nothing more than a San Francisco Bar with some Boston flair.  Never going here again, after wasting the 1st period here.  So unbelievably disappointed.
author: Matthew S.

description:
I know it says sports bar, and they definitely love their sports ...especially from Boston, but I prefer to think of them as great food in a killer local bar atmosphere.  
What bar changes their menu three times and four times a day?  Great attention to the quality of the food.  
You can't go wrong with the Mac and Cheese, Potato Skins or Cod Croquettes for starters or snack, and the burgers are always great!!
Always changing good beer selection and a strange affinity for fernet ?!?
Love this place!!
My only concern is the potato skins comes with three half potatoes??  Where's the other half a potato.. the neurotic in me feels like half potato skins should come in even numbers :)
author: Brian O.

description: Excelent hidden gem on Connecticut street & glad I ventured inside. A great bar with many beers on tap & great lunch menu. The cod croquettes were a great appetizer followed by the fried chicken sandiwches with fresh fruit & also ordered the chopped bacon salad all excellent. They have a beer garden at the back as well.
author: Joni D.

description:
I love this place. 

Back in November we needed a location to throw my baby shower. My partner and I looked all over for a place that can work with our request. While driving from UCSF from an appointment, Connecticut Yankee caught our eye. In emailing the owner with our request, they were were quick to respond. We had the date set, the cost and for the amount of ppl. The day of the baby shower everything went perfect as planned and even better. Food and service was AMAZING. We have went back for our anniversary and we are planning to throw another bash there again in the near future. 

Thanks everyone at Connecticut Yankee
author: Eli G.

description:
This bar is one of SF's hidden gems, tucked away in the beautiful, quiet Portrero Hill neighborhood. I'm not a sports fan, a Boston Bar connoisseur or a meat-eater, but there is plenty to like about this bar!
 
Sangria - do yourself a favor and get a pitcher of this Sangria on a sunny day when you and your friends can snag a table in their back patio! :)

Veggie burger is delicious - they also have some vegan tacos that I haven't gotten around to trying yet.

Lovely Patio seating - I feel like it's hard to come by a lot of good patio seating at bars in SF, this one is definitely top 5 for me! It's beautiful, great ambiance, not too loud and a recommended place to sit for larger groups and people who don't care about sports!

Great service - every single time I've been here the service is great! Each and every one of their servers are friendly, welcoming and on their A-game. All around great vibes from the folks that work here. Keep it up!
author: Jackie K.

description: I used to eat here regularly about 15 years ago, but not lately until my office relocated to Potrero in November.  Well now I'm back and this place is badder than ever!  On recent visits for lunch, I tried the turkey salad sandwich (with chipotle aioli), and the Yankee Burger.  Both were outstanding.  So are the fries here.  Today my friend had the Bim-Bop burger (soy glazed with kimchi and a fried egg) and he was pretty happy.  There are a bunch of things on the menu I'm eager to try, like the carnitas breakfast tacos, the fried chicken sandwich, and the half rack of ribs - so I'll be back soon.  The decor is a pub feel (it's also a pub, with awesome back patio) with lots of old pics of New England sports teams.  As a former New Englander who grew up in New Hampshire, I strongly approve.
author: Dave M.

description:
the food is great. I ordered mushroom roll and it was so delicious. their fries are great. okay prices, and good customer service. they have a lovely patio too if you want to eat or drink outside. haven't gotten
drinks yet but will def go back to this place and will get drink and then will update my review.
author: Helia S.

description:
Boston Bar with great service. Came here with a large party and they were super accommodating and friendly. 

Regardless if you're Boston sports fan, this is a great place to grab some beers and watch a sports game. 

Food is decent too. :)
author: Stephanie W.

description: Always been one of my favourite bars in the city, for a tourist not that easy to get to and as a result always plenty of locals in here, pool table, outdoor seating and food... the bar is a classic old school wooden affair which I love... it's a dive bar with brightness! Solid beer choices and great prices
author: Reg B.

description: Good local bar that is perfect for game watching or just hanging out. Menu is matched well with the kitchen. Good selection of beers on tap and great service.
author: Ed V.

description:
To the italian/medetiranian bartender that worked at 10:50pm on 2/19/18.
I loved your look of surprise when I told you my mom was picking me up.
Some customers have ears of a hawk and I happen to be one of them. Drinking a pitcher of beer quickly has nothing to do with my age. You don't know me.
author: Ricky M.

description: Love this spot! Great chill vibe, nice patio, friendly staff, dog and kid friendly, good food, full bar, need I say more? Unpretentious, which is refreshing these days. Love it. Don't come and ruin it
author: Leslie H.

description: If you're a Boston/ New England sports fan this is the spot. Even all the way in SF, Boston fans are everywhere. If you're a Red Sox, celtics, bruins, or a patriots fan this the the place to go. Pretty typical sports bar set up, sit at the bar or grab a table. Decent size not too small and plenty of televisions. I'd say you can get a good view of a tv pretty much anywhere in the place. The food here was ok. Had the wings and a burger. Typical bar food nothing that knocked my socks off but pretty solid. Beer selection was good and their special aren't  that bad. Came here to watch a celtics playoff game and this place was hopping. Good energy from the Boston loving fans. Like any sports bar bar they will play other games but if Boston is playing, thats what the bar is playing.
author: Peter P.

description:
I think the 3.5 star rating is stop on for this bar/restaurant. 

We held a large birthday party on the patio. The mixed drinks, at least where the bloody Mary's and whiskey sours are concerned, are to be avoided. The issue is mixers. More basic mixed drinks are okay, like rum & coke or a Manhattan.

The food is standard unhealthy fried and breaded fare with some exceptions. Nothing to write home about.
author: Bulldog W.

description:
Food: I've never had anything bad on the menu. The Yankee burger is definitely their signature item, but would definitely recommend trying their garlic cheese bread, mac n cheese, fried chicken sandwich

This place is always poppin at night, great sports bar if that's your deal, and great for lunch if you have the time.

Service can be a little iffy sometimes, but otherwise a good eat.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Wow the menu has definitely upgraded since I last visited! My friends and I decided to come here for brunch after the Spartan race. We highly recommend the Buffalo Wings, Blue Cheese Dusted Wings, Bim Bop Burger and Fish in Chips sliders. The garlic fries were also really yummy!  

Next time I'll have to try their salt and vinegar fries and potato skins! 

Update 09/18/2016

We came back to try the potato skins, the Yankee burger and chorizo tacos and everything was bomb.com!!
author: Erica W.

description: Great surprise.  Came here for comfort food standards, but was surprised by some upscale side dishes.  Try mac n cheese, ribs, brocollini!    Friends loved thier burgers too.  Definitely coming back.
author: Bree T.

description:
I will start with the prices, not bad at all.   I like the selection of drinks here.  The menu of food looks good, i ordered the half and half wings that were delicious.  They are half Buffalo and half blue cheese wings.  

The ambiance is great, I liked the boston atmosphere here, it really is unique feeling if you ever go to boston or simply Massachusetts.  

I look forward to bring my lovely fiance and recommened the bar/restaurant.
author: Raja D.

description: Go Celtics!! Go Giants!! Go Niners!! Food is great!! How much do I have to type to make this a review?
author: Brian B.

description: The Yankee has really upped its game since coming under new ownership a couple years ago. My friends and I have been LOVING the new menu. We dance at the Metronome around the corner, and this has become one of our go-tos for a drink and some bites after class. And my doggie loves the patio. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars: One or two recent games days, when the place really packed, service became chaotic... Food and drinks came very slowly, our server was dropping curse words right and left, we could hear her screaming in the kitchen from our table, and drink runners and bussers were visibly harried. With better staffing for major sporting events, I'd give it 5 stars!
author: Carolyn B.

description: As a Massachusetts native, I can't express how glad I am to have found this bar. I didn't truly know what I was in for until walking in on a Sunday morning (I heard they had nfl ticket online) and being greeted by a sea of pats jerseys. The drinks were cheap (they have some dope combos) and the food was pretty good too. However, the company is what makes the Connecticut Yankee unique. I've always found it hard to find other Boston loyalists in the bay and finally hit the city of gold. If you're a follower of Boston sports you'll feel at home in this bar where you can revel in sportsdom with fellow fans. I plan to come back most sundays and big games in general to enjoy Connecticut yankee's atmosphere and drinks.
author: Alok N.

description: Awesome place for lunch and a noon time bourbon! Staff is friendly and the food is great! Lot's of cool sports memorabilia on the walls for you sports buffs. Definitely coming back!
author: Rodney D.

description: Good sports dive. Very decent pub grub, great for a game. Can get crowded during any New England sport event.
author: Solomon S.

description: Really loud, but I guess that's just what you get from a sports bar. Our server was super friendly and hospitable, despite it being very busy when we went. Nice selection of beers, including an interesting cranberry one that I tried.
author: Jen A.

description: This place is a new and improved version of its old-self. Don't get me wrong, I liked the old version too (and the cast of characters that came along with it), but it's now clean, open, brighter, the food is delicious, and everyone seems genuinely happy to be there. Bob and Tyler were working tonight and those two make a great team. Both were friendly and service oriented. I had the Golden state mighty dry cider, while my husband had a 209 gin and tonic. The cider was light, crisp, and not too sweet. And 209 gin is the best! But listen when I say this-YOU HAVE TO GET THE POPCORN! It is seriously like the best bar snack EVER. So while we don't live locally anymore, I'm glad this place is still a neighborhood spot that has elevated itself and grown with the times.
author: Michelle E.

description:
I rarely write Yelp reviews and, when I do, they're positive ones. 

But our experience was so bad this afternoon that I feel compelled to write a negative review. 

I've been to this neighborhood bar a handful of times and it seemed to have a nice selection of beers and decent bar food. So we decided to go there for an early dinner at around 5pm.

When we arrive we find three drunk men at the bar talking loudly. But we figure that the folks at the place will get things under control. 

But unfortunately it got worse. As the staff and manager of the establishment look on, the three drunks wander around the place knocking over a baby stroller in the process, oogle and harass a young woman, yell at each other as they wander around the bar and sit uninvited at peoples' tables --  all while they continue to be served drinks!  

While SF is a tolerant place, I feel like this is in the realm of "I don't give a shit about my customers" on the part of the staff. Seriously, does the staff want to condone really bad behavior by three drunks at the expense of the rest of the patrons? Well, I suppose I have my answer...
author: Scott C.

description:
I've been the Connecticut yankee twice. Great food and atmosphere!! I recommend their half rack of ribs, which comes with mac-n-cheese! 5/5 stars for taste and flavor!! Meat falls off the bone, and is cooked perfectly. I also tried the Cobb salad and cheeseburger, which are both pretty good. For the salad, they used a zesty lemon dressing, and include bacon, tomatoes, avocado, and cheese. Chicken or steak can be added with extra cost. The cheeseburger was okay, nothing crazy, but I didn't try their specialty burgers. They have a bim-bop burger and a fried chicken burger. 
The place is very relaxing and laid back. Customers can seat yourself and the menus already at the tables. There is a bar at the front, pool table in the back, and small outdoor seating area too. Service is good, but can take longer when busy. Overall, great place for large groups, and if you want to watch a baseball/basketball game, average selection of beers,ciders, and wine.
author: Vickie W.

description: Went to a show at Bottom of the Hill and stopped here for drinks and food. Best service I've had in a very very long time. Katrina was awesome from the get go and there was never a lull in service. Good food and great selection of beer. Prices are fantastic, definitely check this place out!!
author: Keely M.

description: Luv, luv, luv! I've been coming here since my college days at CCAC. It's great to be back to a slightly different, new and improved menu. The potato skins are off the hook!
author: Kimberly P.

description:
Love this place, great food and great atmosphere.  Was going here for all the warriors playoff games and it was a blast, good tunes between the game and easy to re-up on the beer.  A really great mix of folks, young kids and older folks all over, felt very community driven.

Apparently there is a lot of vitriol over "the old way was better" on a lot of these yelp comments.  Admittedly I never knew the old place, but I have absolutely nothing bad to say about the bar.  Most of the nasty comments are maybe just stuck in personal nostalgia?  sorry :-/
author: Taylor C.

description: Stellar customer service, great food, awesome bartenders and staff. Tyler and the other guy are always super friendly.
author: Elliot H.

description:
Love this place! My coworkers and I come here for lunch often. The staff is always very welcoming and very attentive. The food never disappoints and the outdoor patio is a great place to enjoy a meal. 

My order today came out later than everyone else at the table which was not a problem at all considering how busy they were. The staff ended up comping my meal which was very nice of them! Definitely recommend this spot! The fried chicken sando is fire!
author: Nicholas N.

description:
In short, one step forward, five steps back.

I used to work a few blocks down from the Yankee and averaged coming there about once every other week for a few years, I moved just after the change in management and came back for the first time tonight. I had my hopes up after speaking with one of the new managers just after they took over, noting their plan was to keep the same feel, but polish some of the rough edges, specifically mentioning to keep most of the menu, but adding interesting New England themed items like a lobster roll...



The pros:
-The service is better (fwiw I found the old occasionally gristly service endearing)
-They opened up the indoor area for a better layout without ruining it
-Basic things like not having dirty menus, the way silverware is provided, and other small details are done in a more professional manner
-they still serve beer

The cons:
-There is literally nothing left of the old menu
-on the new menu everything is the same overpriced bar food inspired fancy bullshit in every new bar in SF. Loaded potato skins with quail eggs, seriously?!
-I ordered the fish and chip sliders ($15), it literally tasted like burnt bread crust in a bun, and of course they got rid of their delicious crispy corn starch dusted fries....
-it looks like all of their old staff is gone


They might as well have bulldozed the place, because the only thing left at this point is the shit on the walls, what a disappointment.
author: Brian C.

description: Great bar to enjoy with friends.  The Korean burger is the best thing on the menu. My 8 friends all ordered something else. My burger outshined them all. Winning. Oh and they ate Boston fans. Go Red Sox. Staff was super friendly and helped getting us seated and served quickly.
author: Edna H.

description: This place is great. Their lunch menu is full of awesome pub food and the bartenders are solid. Their gnocchi comes off as seasonal and their drink specials really bring everything together.  Bulleit Bourbon shot and an Anchor Steam At Connecticut Yankee - $9. The Hill is lucky to have this place and you should visit. Frequently.
author: BRADY K.

description: Dog friendly and they play hockey games, makes our household very happy. The food is also really good. House made veggie burger and fries really hit the spot. Plus they have Anchor on tap for $5! Can't beat it.
author: Nora C. E.

description:
Sports bar within 2 blocks for the park and a few block way from 280.

Been here a couple times before a softball game at the field. We usually roll in with about 12 people and they're always very accommodating. Last time I came, I ordered the larry birdger burger medium rare and you have a choice of turkey or beef. Searching for my grilled onions, I found out it was under my melted slice of swiss cheese. My bun is saturated on the bottom with grease/oil. 

The fries are always cooked to crispy perfection.
author: Lauren K.

description: This place was great! Went on a Thursday for lunch, was busy but not insanely packed. Great food and great service. I had the chicken sandwich which was great. Surprisingly big piece of chicken which was a nice surprise. We also got the poutine for the table which was tasty. I will certainly be back.
author: Dominic D.

description:
Me and my club brothers decided to have lunch here at the Connecticut Yankee today and were treated badly.  It took forever for the waiter to wait on us and take our order. 
The place only had a few customers. When the guy finally came to take our order everyone got there food except one us. Two had BBQ 1 person had soup and club sandwich the other had a salad all arrived pretty much at the same time.  However, the other guy had to wait more than 20 minutes for his order to arrive after ours had arrived.  And he only order PANCAKES!.  Something that would take less very little time to make.  We were nearly half way done with our meal and he was still waiting for his.  When the pancakes finally arrived he said never mind he refused it.  We paid our bill and left.  Very horrible experience!!!  BTW It was 5 of us.  4 guys where white and one black person. Do the math!
author: Calvin H.

description: The food, drinks and service are top notch! One of my favorite places in San Francisco.
author: Michael M.

description: Connecticut Yankee is the truth. Appears to be a standard sports bar but it is sneaky and subversive. The staff is authentic and fun. The food is way better than it has to be--elevated bar food that's always flavorful and cooked perfectly. Pool table. Outside seating. Great place to catch the Warriors game.
author: Nicholas V.

description:
I hadn't been to the Yankee since it changed hands but when your aunt from Maine is in town on a weekend where the Sox are playing the Yankees, there is really only one place in the neighborhood you can take her without her going into game withdrawal and I'm not talking about Sunflower. 

Aunt approved of the meatloaf and French Onion soup and I really liked the buttery blueberry pancakes. As you may know blueberry pancakes are a religion in Maine so if you bring someone from Ogunquit you gotta get those right. Aunt says they are right if the blueberries are coated in flour before they are put in the batter. Looks like that trick might have been taught at the Yankee. My mother ordered the spaghetti and she was really happy with the straightforward meal and enough food on the plate to justify the price. I really enjoyed the clean white dishware. Made the meals very appealing. 

I would stay away from the Arnold Palmer unless you are a fan of Crystal Light. Maybe a Shandy would have covered up the saccharine taste but ice tea couldn't do much. Might have to work on that because usually any woman who orders an Arnold Palmer when everyone else is ordering a Bloody Mary is giving a tip off that she has a bun in the oven. 

All in all, the Yankee put my Aunt in a good enough mood so she would come with us to a National League Park at ATT. This is something said American Leaguer had vowed she would never do.
author: Lisa R.

description: Second bad review for this restaurant, for essentially the same reason. Ordered food after our softball game and it took 40 minutes for them to take our orders and deliver our food.  The restaurant was about 1/3 full. No offer to comp anything  or acknowledgement that this is unacceptable. They also screwed up a bunch of orders at our table. Not excited about eating here again although it is part of our post-game ritual.
author: Sarah T.

description:
1987-2015
REST In Peace Connecticut Yankee
You Will Be Missed

Just as investors bought the rights to the legendary CBGBs only to open a a cheesy  eatery in the Newark airport with its name & logo, the Pour Guys have gutted the spirit of this place in order to expand their brand of yuppie watering holes.

Honestly some of improvements the new investors have made are nice, others not so much. 

The unforgivable sin however is theyve ended live music in this bar. Live music has been a staple at this location for over a hundred years. The names and owners have changed but this place has been a staple of SF music history...until these poor guys got their hands it.

Frits has been the owner for last 30 years and he understood its legacy and truly ran it the right way.   

I guess from an investors point of view  :Business Model A: Where a guy walks into a bar spends 3 hours listening to live music with a paid band & sound guy and buys 3-4 $5 beers. Is not as profitable as Business Model B:  Yuppie walks into a bar orders 2-3 $13 cocktails & is gone in under half an hour.

Many incredible musicians have have graced this stage over the years and folks from all over the bay area made many trips to the hang out at The Yankee, I even met people from way up the coast who drove several hours to come here. If lived in mission I wouldn't bother making my way over here just for drink, and since I live in Emeryville I certainly wont be returning. 

Truly a sad day for San Francisco
author: Jon S.

description:
This place has had a make-over with the new management. Luckily, they kept the waiter, Bob (I think) who is a joy. They've taken down the back wall (where the bands were) so you can see the pool table. 

They have a new menu too. Had the clam chowder, which was delicious! They make a mean martini too.

It's a solid sports bar with great service and good food.
author: Mi M.

description: Laid-back vibe devoid of the snooty elements o' SF.  Great food and always friendly service.  If you're looking to catch a game with friends, go here.
author: Dan K.

description:
We had a party of close to 40 family members and friends in the rear of the restaurant by the new pool table. Our brunch menu included: french toast, chorizo burritos, ham and cheese croissants, corndogs, egg quiche, fruit salad as well as potato salad. All the food came from the kitchen fluidly. None of our guests were without food. The spread of food came out for roughly an hour. On a scale of 1 to 10, our brunch was a solid 10.7. The food was fresh, hot and delivered quickly.

Our service was consistently great. From food, to water requests, to our signature champagne drink, to tableware; everything requested, specific to our party, was delivered quickly and accurately. Our brunch began at 10:30 and while it was busy elsewhere, the attention to detail to our group's needs was greatly appreciated.

If you are a bar hound, food snob or New England sports aficionado...pop a squat and enjoy yourself.
author: Benjamin G.

description: Met up with a friend before seeing a band at the venue down the street.  This place is super relaxed and I had a great root beer float!  The staff was attentive and fun which made it an even better night.  It was so nice to see families gathered at tables.
author: Krislyn T.

description:
Sadly, new owners have taken over and changed the menu. Fritz we miss you.

 Used to have one of the best Clam Chowders and one of the best Cobb Salads in the entire city IMO. Chowder is now gummy and thick and the Cobb had pink pickled eggs (ugh ), no avocado or tomato and a dressing that added nothing. New versions of these dishes are not even in the top fifty.

Was one of my favorite places for lunch in the city for twenty plus years.

 Oh well time marches on.
author: Craig B.

description: $20 for an order of fries and 6 cold buffalo wings. This place should be ashamed of itself.
author: Patty D.

description:
Sav and a bunch of us stopped here for brunch and board gaming one Sunday. I must say the back patio here is pretty awesome. We were able to get as loud as we wanted while intensely playing our games.

The food here is your typical brunch type. It was pretty decent. I ended up getting the Wade Boggs which is a grilled chicken sandwich with a side salad. It was pretty filling and worth having something to go along with our game boarding.

Our server was attentive and helpful. She also let us stay as long as we wanted which was definitely a good thing. The Yankee is a bit more tucked away so if you're coming from the East Bay, you're better off driving. Luckily, there is street parking out here.
author: Amy J.

description: Liked it before, love it now. Beer list, menu, food quality, and service are noticeably improved. My new go-to bar on the hill!
author: Cory D.

description:
Perfect little bar & grill.  Stopped here before a show at the neighboring Bottom of the Hill club.  Had wings and a couple of IPAs.  Wings were good, beer was good, got to watch MNF on the TV and the owner and bartender were super nice to boot.

This is what every neighborhood sports bar should be.
author: K.C. B.

description: This place was recommended by friends and I'm glad we took the chance! The burgers were absolutely delicious, highly recommend the garlic fries... and the server Bob was super sweet! They also have a wide selection of beer at very affordable prices. Def a must try :)
author: Josie Q.

description: I live literally next door to this place (just moved in) and have been a few times and enjoyed great service from everyone who works here. They have been especially sweet with my dog, who I have brought in a few times. I was there with just my dog today and a guy was sitting near me with his seven year old daughter. She came up to my dog and pet her and was playing with her for several minutes. I heard the dog growl and she jerked her hand away and the guy went off on me, saying my dog had attacked her. He started swearing at me and calling me an asshole for not "doing something" to the dog  to fix it. The kid didn't seem to have any visible injury and I hadn't seen what she had done to provoke my dog, which was calm and sitting next to me st this point. The dog is seven years old and has never bit anyone and spent a lot of time in public and around other people and dogs. The guy got up and a few minutes later the waitress told me I had to leave. She was very apologetic and paid for my meal, but I'm really upset about this because they encourage people to bring dogs, nothing actually happened that I could see, and the guy was really aggressive and rude after the fact. Maybe he is a friend of the owner? I don't know but i was humiliated that they made me leave and really disappointed by this experience and I don't think I would ever go back with or without my dog.
author: Molly T.

description: Great place for a drink and some good food. John and Johnnie were great behind the bar, glad I checked it out.
author: Zack K.

description: Good food, the burger was delicious and the broccoli salad that came with it, excellent. Nice place to watch sports, drink beer and eat some good pub food.
author: Martino P.

description:
This is a sports bar?  Hmmm.   I  found it to be more of a dive bar (an abused term in San Francisco where any neighborhood tavern that hasn't been redecorated since the seventies is called one).   I went in for beer, saw there was a kitchen, and when I was told that the calamari was fresh (not frozen) ordered some.  Damned good calamari.  The breaded fries were better than In N Out, but that's not saying very much as In N Out's undercooked fries are as bad as their burgers are good.  Mostly the fries here tasted like an vehicle for cooking oil delivery.

Then, someone came up to pay for their negroni.  Negroni?   I would NEVER order a Negroni in a neighborhood bar---even good restaurants often don't make a good one.  So I ordered one...

It seems that the key to success with a drink built from an equal measure of three ingredients is to MEASURE the damn ingredients.  Which the bartender here did, and the result was that sublime flavor that delights the senses.  It turns out that square ice blocks or toasted orange peel isn't what makes it.  This was a fine Negroni (unlike the one I had afterwards, on Polk street, where the bartender poured the campari without measuring it [measuring the gin and vermouth only] and which, thus unbalanced, fell short of sublime).

The crowd, unlike Blooms up the hill, seemed to be something other than local (from the neighborhood), but I'm not sure about that.  Blooms' crowd had a distinctly working class feel (was that an accurate assessment on my part?) while the folks here had a more white collar feel---rather odd given the dive-y atmosphere.  It seems both folks live on the hill as boutiqued houses seem to be balanced by quite a large number of original structures under faded or peeling paint.  I don't seem to fit in anywhere I go, so nothing seemed out of place to me, and the staff was quite useful and friendly.

I'd go back.  I'll have the calamari over the fries.  Order at least one negroni, and maybe even try a burger.
author: Paul T.

description:
I'm slightly biased since my uncle was one of the original owners of this joint... :) 

Stopped by for a snack & beer with my husband yesterday. Was a bit nervous since there has been a bit of a divide amongst yelp reviewers recently. However, I'm pleased to say that is seems like the new owners are doing a nice job of honoring the original feel, while giving it some needed updates.

The potato wedges were delicious--not to mention they're still rocking Steve's hot sauce. Big win!
author: Caitlin B.

description: Great neighborhood bar and awesome spot to watch the Red Sox - or other Boston sports teams.
author: pam h.

description: Food and drink galore.  Love the BLT salad, chicken chili and fried cheese.  Best lunch/bar spot on Mariposa!
author: Michelle H.

description: We duked it out in the rain! Not only did the owners take care of us with umbrellas but they consistently came out to take shots and make sure we were well taken take of. As a die hard New England fan, I will definitely be coming back here
author: Kayla R.

description:
We kill nights and eat them for breakfast. Wherever we go and whatever we do, we know how to do it right. 

Set out to have fun, any venue and any event is just that much more enjoyable with good company. We went to the Yankee with the intent of seeing some live music and good times. Only $6 for the show and a few rounds, it was a fun and inexpensive place to see some live entertainment. 

A small stage, fun crowd, lively music and some great swing dancing by a couple - set the night. Drinking Bourbon with Speakeasy Chasers, I was in for a night of having fun, drinking and enjoying the show.  Hurray for the Connecticut Yankee.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Lot's of softball players come here, it's also quite loud.   I think i prefer blooms or thee park side.
author: Michael E.

description:
Love this place, been coming for 15 years as its right down the hill. Unfortunately tonight, game 7 of the Warriors, game 1 of the Cup, they decided NOT to show the Sharks game on any of the 8 TVs in the main bar area. Would not be a big deal, but we got there at 415pm and specifically asked for a table to see both   They said or would be on 3X over the course of an hour

Was told repeatedly by the staff by"sorry" nothing we can do.   We were offered to give up our table and go stand in the back by the lone TV showing the game.

Well, there is something I can do.  I would rather spend my money at another local place, Blooms, which is much more accommodating

Sorry CT Yankee  

I miss Fritz
author: Brian S.

description:
This was our first visit to Connecticut Yankee.  Loved the sports bar atmosphere but was still very family friendly.  This was important since our group had two toddlers in it.  Two members of our party have a dietary restriction which they gladly accommodated.  The food was fresh, hot and tasty.  The bartender recommended a cocktail that we'd never tried and it was delicious.  

Can't wait to see what the new owners do once the weather gets warmer and the patio opens.
author: Carleen C.

description: This bar has finally transformed into the best sports bar & food in Potrero Hill. New ownership brought in positive vibes & the food is better than ever. Fresh grapefruit juice 24/7. What I call "The Rejuvenator" fresh squeezed grapefruit & Ocho tequila. Open space with an outdoor patio large enough for parties. Eat. Play pool. Cheer for your team. All good.
author: TVAT T.

description:
CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD STATEMENT IF YOU PAY WITH PLASTIC!!

Some coworkers decided to throw a Farewell Party for a coworker that was leaving for greener pastures. We decided on Connecticut Yankee because of it's close proximity to work and within walking distance. Service for the most part was friendly. 

Fast forward to a week later and I happen to be going over my credit card statement. I notice the charge is $2 more than what I know I wrote down for the final charge. Yes, I bet you're thinking "This girl is raging over a $2 overcharge?" YES. YES I AM. Because of the principle that I TIPPED GREAT and they had the nerve to take advantage of my kindness and add MORE money to the final charge. On a bill that totaled $97.XX (before tip), I was too buzzed to do that math and know for a fact I wrote a final charge for $120 compared to my statement that says $122.  (that's a $22+ tip on a ~$98 bill) Of course I disputed this charge with my bank, and when I called and asked how it would be credited back to my account, the representative told me that the bank would most likely just reimburse the amount because it's so small. It upsets me that this bar is going to get away with taking advantage of my kindness. 

And what pisses me off more now with this revelation is that while I was closing my tab, I noticed they overcharged me by one shot of Jameson. (I purchased 2 but they charged me for 3) I didn't make a huge stink about it and didn't bother to dispute the charge. NOW I WISH I HAD. 

This could have been a great after-work bar that I would have visited more frequently, but not after this dishonesty.
author: Jenna H.

description: Best bar ever! Visited San Francisco from RI.  Needed to watch the Patriots game. This place came up as a New England sports bar and it sure was. Get there early as seats fill up fast! Made friends with a lot of locals who were originally from the east coast. Great environment and friendly staff.
author: Katie O.

description: Decent beer selection, cool decor, and great music!just enough TVs, too. Didn't try the food yet
author: Brooke P.

description: Oh dear. This used to be our comfort food tavern of choice. Now it's new menu is fussy and mediocre. Please bring back the basics. Do the over seasoned fries and provolone aioli pickle burger as an option. So sad to lose the Yank. Please come back to us.
author: Valerie W.

description: New menu (new owners) trying too hard. This is an established old-school SF sports bar.  Keep it simple. They will come, Ray.
author: Peter M.

description: I like it being brighter and still have the good buffalo wings. It might not have the same blinds at the window but the fixtures are still there. Never really pay w8th cards in such types of joint anyway so if you have to and then complain about it.. oh well..
author: Wailin L.

description: I like this place. It's alright. Don't have high expectations, but the burgers are good and drinks are good. As long as you're not looking for something special and just a local, good place, this is a great place. Thumbs up for being a bar with food. Those are always good to know. I like to come here every now and then since work is near by for a drink or late dinner. It's good. It's solid. That's the best way to put it. Don't come here looking for something extra. This place is just your neighborhood bar/restaurant.
author: Julie L.

description: Good, semi-divey spot to watch a game (especially if you're from Boston) or grab some drinks with friends.  They have a pretty solid beer selection and make a good bloody mary on weekends.  The food is surprisingly solid!  There's also a small outdoor patio out back.  Worth stopping by if you find yourself in Potrero Hill.
author: Andrew E.

description: It's gone downhill with new ownership. Food takes forever to get even when not crowed. Main meal before apps and wrong orders sad it was one of our neighborhood mainstays
author: Pamela W.

description: Decent beer selection and good food and pats football. No better place to watch a pats game!
author: Cy D.

description: This place is amazing! It's a cross between a great dive and nice restaurant. Gritty atmosphere with delicious food laid out in beautiful way.
author: Katie P.

description:
I asked if they still have their steak salad, "if we had a steak salad, then it would be just steak, right?"
Ok, I ordered the BLT salad, add steak? 
Got our food. I asked for Tabasco, super nice server/bartender gave us what we needed.
said earlier asshole bartender literarlly took the tabasco off the bar and gave us another hot sauce. I asked for the tabasco back, since its what i asked for in the first place.
when we asked for our food to go, he came out and told us how to heat up our mac-n-cheese separate from our ribs. 
This was too much. I work in a bar up the street from the Yankee and just wanted to enjoy a beer and "steak salad" after work. done.
author: Messi D.

description: Glad the new owners cleaned it up a bit, and added a pool table, but the menu got dumbed down from fun, interesting and tasty, to rather mediocre. Can you bring back some of the old items? All my favorites that were on the menu are gone, and the Ty Cobb salad isn't close to what it was. Oh, and please do something with men's bathroom - it's always been gross - please show it some attention.
author: Brian S.

description: Came in at the end of a pats game. So lively and fun!! Food was great and even though very busy the service was awesome!! Will definitely be coming back.
author: Dominique U.

description: I've been going to the Yank for years and it used to be awesome but the recent management changeover and subsequent "up-scaling" leaves a little to be desired. Beer selection is still reasonable but pricey and the new menu sucks. The "new" Buffalo wings are terrible; there's nothing Buffalo about them, and what happened to the veggie sticks? The shredded mess they came with was abysmal at best. Stop it, you're trying too hard. Bring back the Mike Stivic and stop ruining one of SF's best neighborhood sports bars and I might return.
author: James W.

description:
This place is TOTAL shit.  Once I was completely ignored.  Literally no one ever came over.  I waited patiently at the bar and then just left.  I was invited for lunch there and thought oh this time it will be nice to get someone to bring you some of their shitty food.  I WAS WRONG!  The service was worse than being ignored.  
Go here if you want to waste money on shit food being surrounded by shit people.  My only hope for this restaurant is a sink hole.
author: D E.

description:
I really like the fact that this is a New England Patriots bar, but the service is awful; the waitstaff and bartenders are extremely rude! I will not be coming back to this bar and I will do my best to ensure none of my friends return. 

One example was when we were at the bar a patron politely asked the bartender if we could put on the Patriots game that had started 5 minutes prior (note this is a Patriots bar with Patriots fans everywhere) and the bartender answered rudely: "you know how to use a remote, do it yourself, I don't have the remotes or know where they are!" 

Another example of their uncivil and uncourteous manner was when we sat down to order food. I pride myself on being polite to servers as I was one in a prior life, but this particular server made every food and drink request appear to be a chore and inconvenience. On multiple occasions we had to follow up with our orders and were afraid to due to her aggressive and intimidating demeanor. 

I realize that waitstaff have an extremely difficult job and are very often under-appreciated, however, this bar in particular has a myriad of disgruntled employees. Some of the issue appears to be related to stress due to the high ratio of customers to employees, though they should try and hire more help if that is the case.
author: Robert W.

description: Wow! Fantastic! Stepped into the Connecticut Yankee after about a year and was absolutely blown away by the fantastic job the new owners have done. They have managed to retain the iconic history of a fabulous San Francisco landmark, while at the same time breathing fresh new air into what everyone knows is the best burger place in town! The menu is as fantastic as ever (with some great new changes), their sangria is off the charts, and we had a wonderful dining experience and fun time as always. Last but not least, all of the authentic, original MLB memorabilia (original Babe Ruth batting lineup sheet, anyone?) has been moved from the original cramped, dark entranceway to a large wall inside the restaurant, showcasing it in all its glory as it deserves to be.  It is refreshing to see a new ownership come into a historic place and desire to not only retain but enhance the rich and beautiful history of a landmark San Francisco location.  "Bob, the Waiter" who has been a steadfast fixture for years remains as upbeat, festive and "saucy" as ever.  Ask to sit in his section  and prepared to be not only served excellently but entertained by his enjoyable quick wit ...... Job well done, new owners!!
author: Emma A.

description: Been going here since 2009 and have to say it's a great place. The only time I go is with my softball teammates after we're done with practice just down the street from them the restaurant. The staff are always nice, food is great, drinks are good, and if there's a game on you can watch it with one of the many TV's they have up.
author: Kyle G.

description: I've seen some review that complain about the staff being rude, so I'll start by saying that this is a great dive bar and the service is in line with what I'd expect from a dive bar.  The bartender has a bit of an attitude, but it comes off to me like someone who's having fun with their job and not someone who's mistreating customers.  On the contrary, the service is pretty good.  When my glass is approaching empty, I'm offered another and the food comes out hot.  The food I've had has been pretty good.
author: Trilo B.

description: I was going to give 4stars,But i dont know why..The food was delicious ,our server Bob is awesome..I love it here..Nice quaint not to crowded relaxing atmosphere..Btw Im so sorry i didnt post a pic of the Clam Chowder or the Onion rings or The chicken, mashed potatoes and green beans we ate..It was so good we ate it before we could think..
author: Kat S.

description: I have had two horrible experiences here. I thought the first one was a fluke so I came back. The bartender is extremely rude and short with customers. I left him no tip to communicate my dissatisfaction with the service and he came to the back patio and announced that me and my girlfriend were "nontippers". Strongly discourage anyone from coming here.
author: Ryan T.

description:
Our band played a gig here last month.  We enjoyed a pretty tasty pre show dinner - I had the veggie burger which was good, but I ditched the overly fluffy bun.  They have a good selection of beers we happily partook in.

If you're a band looking to play here, know that the stage is small, and the show will start late - sound check not until after 10pm when they stop serving dinner - but you will be treated very well (assuming you're not a jerk to the staff).  We got discounted dinner, some drink tickets, a thoughtful and attentive sound guy, and good music and local lore type conversation with the bartender.

Fun place, but beware of the neighborhood.  There have been several car break-ins recently...two attendees at our show to name a few.
author: Sarah C.

description: The CY is the perfect little neighborhood bar and eatery. Great friendly service and atmosphere. Place is hard to beat. If you want a solid pub experience this is the place. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants a to have a good time.
author: Jet C.

description: Awesome, fun place especially for New England sports fans! I lost my ID there and they were nice enough to mail it to me! Try the turkey club. YUM!
author: taylor G.

description:
People of Potrero, bring your Big Wheel, cause this place has gone downhill!!  The Yankee used to be a chill spot to have a beer, nosh, watch a game, and/or watch a show.  But lately...I don't know what's happened. Surly new bartenders now yell at you to keep your voice down when you're watching a play-off game, but the small children running around screaming is A-ok?  WTF are these kids doing in the bar? 

And now the food just plain sucks.  I mean, it wasn't great to start with but damn, ick!  The last time I was here, just sealed its fate for me.  While a friend and I were eating said icky food, some manager of a band was collecting cover for his band that about to perform. He was demanding money from us right in front of the manager/owner, Fritz?,  to stay and finish eating our food? Not a damn word from Fritz, but douchey band manager kept insisting that we had to pay his $13 cover to be able to stay and finish eating. Seriously? 

So that's it, so long, I'm happy to grab my beer and chomp on tater tots down the street at Parkside.
author: CeeLo L.

description: The Gnocchi was ridiculous. Meatloaf isn't even comparable to your grandma's and trust me on the BLT salad, you won't be sorry. I'll be back, like tomorrow.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: I went in again and Bob our old waiter was there. He made some recommendations on the menu and we tried them...as he knew we were regulars and disappeared since the new takeover. The place has gotten better, but I disagree with the owner who said it was a bit dramatic wording from someone below. The initial change was like an EPIC change to the people who loved that place...in a bad way. But it's gotten better. The great Meatloaf & Chicken cutlet are gone, replaced with more basic bar choices. It's gone from BAD to OK for me. But miss the old menu items and those green beans even begin haters would love on those plates!! Bring back the old favorites and you get the old favorite locals back too!
author: The Style R.

description: Love this spot! Hosted a private event there last night and they did an excellent job. The staff was super friendly, the food was awesome and my guests had an amazing time. Highly recommend it here.
author: Andy P.

description: I had the meatloaf, NOT, had no flavor, also asked for mashed potatoes and i guess they don't have any.  The new owners are nice and the place is brighter. Too bad the food is not up to par. Good luck with your business. .... If you bring back the foul play, i will be a return customer
author: Nick M.

description:
The reason we like coming here is Bob... and the Fowl Play. 

It's a good place to watch football and baseball games too.

Wish they bring back their Saturday prime rib night!
author: Wakaknee J.

description: This is the place for great food, a beer and a game watch. They have plenty of TVs to accommodate any sports interest.  And the food is so good! Whether you want a killer burger, a tuna melt, home made soups or a great salad, they have you covered.  It's not your typical greasy bar food. It's legit.
author: Joe S.

description:
3.5 stars- Your typical neighborhood charming sports bar with a huge menu selection-
Authentic vibe with decent food. Every visit is pleasant-
author: Lynn J.

description: Although it's "just" a sports bar, the Yankee serves one of the best burgers in the City.  My only complaint was that they had no New England origin beers on tap. Come to watch sports and drink beer; stay for the burger!!
author: Alan P.

description: Being part of the Red Sox/Pats diaspora, it's hard to find a bar where you can truly let yourself go rooting for them, let alone find them playing on the TV.  Connecticut Yankee fills that void.  It's where like-minded New England transplants ("exPats?") can get together and cheer on Tom Brady or Big Papi.  Someone was saying that Left Coasters don't seem to get as rowdy as New England folks about their sports.  I'm not sure that's true.  But it's nice to be in a bar where the Rs are slipping and people are cheering their hardest for your team.  Give them a try!
author: Seth E.

description:
This is the place where you want to go to for beer, bar food, quiet, and to lounge allllll day.   We were here from noon to 4pm. It never got too busy, the service was friendly, the ambiance is alright for a hundred year old building, parking was easy to find this Saturday afternoon. 

Two friends liked the wings, I though it was just okay in the cook em and pour hot sauce over em and serve em kinda way. My garlic steak sandwich was not garlicky, not raw like I asked, and quite chewy. The fries were yummy. The Bloody Mary punches you in the nose. 

That's all.
author: Walerz B.

description: The older man bartender is hilarious!! You seriously could not miss out on his awesome humor and generosity!! The food is amazing especially the veggie chili and garlic fries!! This is one stop not to miss out on!!
author: Jason P.

description: OK place.  More than a little run down.  Dogpatch and Potrero are only going to get more gentrified, so a remodel would be a good call.  That being said, the service is fine, the beer is cold, although a bit expensive.  Never had a mixed drink, so can't comment on the pours.  The food is always excellent - never had a bad meal here.  So the CY seems to have a bit of an identity crisis - a seedy dive bar, in an upscale neighborhood, with high prices, and excellent food.  Worth a visit and a nice meal.  Parking sux
author: Ken P.

description: Good place to get delicious bar food/cheap drinks served by nice/fun people, whether you're alone or with 10 other people. It's the type of non-pretentious restaurant that SF needs a lot more of. They're beyond dog friendly, too. Go here if you're tired of paying a shit ton of money for obnoxiously small plates of food.
author: Will R.

description: Connecticut Yankee is my fave local place to watch a Giants game or hang out with friends. It's been wildly rearranged, but the food is still good. We had a Santa Fe spinach salad which was great, and salt and vinegar fries. Mmmmm. Our favorite waiter, Bob, is still there. We call him the world's fastest waiter. He never lost patience with our uber annoying questions, believe me, annoying.
author: Carolyn C.

description:
Been here 3 times and don't recommend it. 

First time was decent service and mediocre food at lunchtime.

Second time, the old grey-haired man behind the bar was working the front. Service was horrible...I practically had to beg for service. There were only 3 people there, including this guy. Food took a while to come out too. Then I had to wait forever to get my bill.

Third time was only because my coworker wanted to go there. Same old guy orders us to pick up the menus ourselves and go look at the board for specials. I guess it's too difficult to just let your customers know. I got the chicken taco salad. It was pretty good until I found hair at the bottom. 

Don't waste your time here. Only reason I don't give it one star is because I've seen worse.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Good clam chowder. My only regret was that I only had a cup instead of a bowl. 

Really cute atmosphere in a great neighborhood. I also had the fish and chips, which was really good. 

If you can sit on the patio, you should.
author: Dayna D.

description: Really good burger and great range of beers on tap.  A good, honest pub in Potrero Hill area.  Nothing fancy but a nice place to hang out.  I will come back.
author: Joel K.

description: Great music (AC/DC, Black Sabbath) great prices on craft beer and domestic with plenty of specials. Big windows and just enough TVs. Got here early to watch a 10AM NFL game before an Anchor Steam brewery tour
author: Jeremy P.

description: The service here is unbelievably awesome. Courteous, cool, helpful staff. The food is much better under the new ownership too. Creative menu and very tasty dishes. Great combination of basics and unexpected very un-bar type dishes. Really love this place.
author: Meghan C.

description: Asked for the celtics game and they didn't get the channel. You can't claim to be a Boston sports bar if you don't get all the games. With that said the food and service were good.
author: Robert F.

description: This place is GREAT! But why put four stars you ask? One of the servers/hostess whatever you want to call him is a complete bastard! I can honestly say he ruined my dining experience. Very rude when we asked to be seated, very rude when I requested to know the beer selection, very rude when I gave him my order. Maybe he was just having a bad day? Who knows. All I know is that I came to Connecticut Yankee because it was my deceased fathers' favorite place to eat in San Francisco and I was completely turned off by the way that man treated my boyfriend and I. Two of the men (a little older in age) are incredibly kind and excellent workers, but the guy who is about thirty years of age (brown short hair, clean cut) just needs a reality check on how to treat customers. I don't understand why he works there.
author: Lucy B.

description:
Terrible service. Had the privilege of being ignored by the bartender multiple times, while in the nearly empty bar on a weekend night. And by ignored I mean I signaled him, stood in plain sight, said "excuse me", while he kept passing me by again and again.

Decor and conditions of the restaurant are quite poor. Dingy and humdrum and blah. Not pleasant, prices are higher than they should be, and it's just not a very nice place to relax.
author: Will M.

description:
Connecticut Yankee bills itself as an east coaster escape from the west/best coast (go in there and order an It's It, I dare you), and having spent many a night in east coast bars this last year, I'd say it's a pretty decent facsimile, but that also doesn't make it all that good. 

It has a few staples, there's chowdah and decent cheese steaks, but the fries were pretty average and having Anchor Steam on tap and fish tacos on special kind of rings a bit out of place. Maybe I missed them, but I was looking for craft beers from back east or a crab cake sandwich, but didn't find either.

If you're looking for a decent sports bar in the state-street area, check out Connecticut Yankee. If you're looking to be magically transported back to the pubs of your home turf, this may not meet your needs.
author: Kevin B.

description: Great joint!  Ordered a beer (modern times: go San Diego), burger (came with I fried egg on top, what's better than anything with a fried egg on top?), and a cup of clam chowder (must have been the bottom of that batch. I've never had a clam chowder with that many clams! Delicious!). I would recommend any day of the week. I'm only in San Francisco for a few weeks, but I'll be back!
author: Christopher M.

description: This place is a fucking joke----go to the Kezar Pub if you want a friendly, high service, quality sports bar experience. Worst wait staff in the western hemisphere, and fairly shitty food, as well.
author: Tom B.

description:
* Review for their Hot Wings ONLY*

I wonder if part of proceeds from Connecticut Yankee's 'O.J.'s Buffalo Wings' ($8.25) now goes to helping O.J. recover his photos?  Their menu could not keep up with O.J.'s criminal activities as it still read that the proceeds goes to 'helping O.J. find the real killers.'

Ignoring the name, I enjoyed their O.J.'s Buffalo Wings.  It was HOT HOT HOT - which went well with their beer.  I wished there was slight sweetness, but that's okay.  In the city lacking serious Buffalo Wing joints, I was satisfied with their version.  Most importantly, it was NOT breaded.  

DECOR:  This establishment appears to be more of a bar from the outside, but it's actually more of a restaurant when you walk in.  They have numerous tables with a server taking orders.  They even have a nice size outdoor patio seating.  Menu has pretty much everything you need for lunch, brunch, or dinner.  

HISTORY:  From the reading on the back of their menu, you'll learn that this is a quite historic bar/restaurant, which started in 1907 (under a different name).

On my next visit, I'll try Barry Bonds Super Star and Ty Cobb Salad.
author: トモ T.

description:
I recently move to Potrero Hill and am looking for a new sports bar to hang out at on Sundays. This place will not be my new spot.

While the food was good from what my friends said, the service is HORRIBLE! It took them twenty minutes to even glance our way. Another 15 to seat us. Then another 20 minutes to take our order. Seriously awful. All I wanted was a beer to sip while watching the Niners. Sad.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
They have the best wings I've tried in a long time, really good burgers, and awesome fries. There's also really good entrees, but sometimes the garlic stuff is way too garlicky. Last time we tried the "cajun" chicken, and it was surprisingly good. 

Really friendly service. I like these guys.
author: Grecia G.

description:
Uhhh, YES PLEASE!

This place is great. Awesome beer, tasty food, friendly staff, and great patrons. Multiple televisions with local sports on.

I hit this place up an hour before a show at Bottom of the Hill for some food and brews. I had a cup of soup and a local brew, both of which were top notch. 

I will return when in the area.
author: Justin C.

description:
not bad. but, not great either.
the food was good, but the vibe of the place is way off from the last time we were here.

granted that was over 7-years ago and a lot of the former sf crowd has long since split, or been evicted by the dot-com crowd, but still.  the place should have some character left.  no band, no crowd, nothing?  

there goes the neighborhood, I guess.
author: Joe S.

description: I am very reticent to give a negative review, but people should be warned. I came here on a Sunday evening, starving. Looked like a decent menu with pub food, but before I could finish my first beer the bartender proved to be such a jerk, I could not continue to give him business. He was absolutely rude and insulting, without any provocation. In fact, I and my better half are always very polite. There are too many places in the SF to go here.
author: JN W.

description:
It's a Boston bar in all senses including service.  If you want something else, there are plenty of other sports bars with seatings, more fancy drinks and food, and the way they serve.  But if you want straightforward drinks and food sometimes standing up, this is your place.

Four stars only because sometimes the service is a little bit surly even for my tastes.
author: Daniel Y.

description:
I've eaten here twice. One time a band setup and started playing during dinner. It was a great surprise as I love some live music!

Go for the burger if you're on the fence between a sandwich or a burger.

Also, watching local sports here is a fun time.
author: Ameer N.

description:
I like the atmosphere at the Yankee.  It's cozy and the food is decent. Not great but decent.  Beer is always good of course.  I like going there when you get turned away from the Parkside because they have a band and refuse to let you in for food without paying $12.
