Connecticut Yankee never does that - Staff is sassy, it's true but once they get to know you they stop giving you the stink eye.  Then they remember what you drink and make you feel at home... Solid place.
author: Dave T.

description: My boyfriend and I had the taco salad and garlic chicken nuggets. Salad was good. Nuggets not so much. Waitress was nice and attentive and it was fun to see everything that dates the place back to 1907 on the walls.
author: Amy A.

description: Love the revitalized Yankee! I know it's a neighborhood mainstay and lots of locals have been pissed at the changes but I for one like the updates. It actually doesn't skeeve me out to sit and order a burger and I am glad the new owners didn't mess with the ambiance of the place too much. Keep it up, guys!
author: Steph S.

description: The food was sub- par and the server was soooooooooooooooooOoOoOoOoOooOoo rude. If I wasn't with a group, I would have just left. Ew to the attitude. Only reason it's not 1 star is I liked the outside back patio.
author: Isabelle A.

description:
Really fun place for New England fans to come watch their team. Everyone is very friendly. There's a good atmosphere, great drinks and decent food.

It's also in a nice location in Potrero Hill.
author: Anthony Y.

description:
I came here last night with my boys for the first time and it was delightfully chill. The patio was a good size with heated lamps and the service was quick and dirty ;) The crowd was eclectic, but refreshingly so and they had a baseball game on for the times you didn't feel like talking. Dude, what more can you ask for?! 

We didn't order food, but I guess I'll have to come back! 3 whiskey gingers later and we were off on another adventure. 

Good times.
author: Kitty K.

description: 12 am -Last Call on a Friday night Yikes.
author: Eugene L.

description: Food/drinks  are not good!!!! The locals are very rude, and want you to leave!  If your not from the area don't come!
author: Manny O.

description:
This is a lunch review.  

Don't come here for lunch, if you're in the neighborhood the Ramp is much better.  We ordered some chips and salsa and the chips were slightly stale and not freshly fried like at the Ramp.  I ordered a burger and it was so greasy it soaked through the bottom half of the bun.  They must use really fatty beef.  Also, all the meat was cooked medium-well to well-done, regardless of what you asked for.  

The only good part of my dish was the fries, which are super crunchy on the outside.
author: Beatrice W.

description: Worst service I've ever received in my life. Susanna was beyond rude. I think she was just overwhelmed by the amount of people in the bar. Then.... She brought us a free pitcher of beer AND TOTALLY REDEEMED HERSELF!!! Went from 1 star to 4. I'll be coming back
author: Maxwell A.

description: bouncing back, neighborhood feel is dead and gone....for sure....but the food is better than before, the crowd is not my crowd, and what a shame they canned the old staff, but where in SF is the same anymore?
author: Mark S.

description: This is a great place. A real find. Excellent food and service, with ambiance to spare. It's a one of a kind, with a one of a kind history, and location.
author: Barbara i.

description:
Sunday brunch?  An hour wait?  Creepy men stalking the streets in shiny vests?!  We should've come straight here had we known about this place.  But thanks to the underage in our group, the guys and I happened upon this pub in our search for a bar that accepted kids to get our midday drinks on.

The outside patio on a balmy Frisco day was the perfect answer.  The waitresses were very attentive and quick in service, unlike the pig palace we were just at.  Though they didn't have Grey Goose on hand, Ketel One was just as good.  I had two to quench my thirst.  The guys had mimosas and beer.  The kid, Arnold Palmer to make him feel all growed up.

The next time we find ourselves in the area, I think we'll return.  Perfect way to spend a midday with good friends and good booze.
author: Lorrayne L.

description: I'm in love with CY. I've seen the before and after and the new management has done good. Its clean, good fresh food, a pool table and booze! Perfect!
author: LS C.

description: A local bar restaurant  out of the the tourist zone but offering a locals only atmosphere that was still fun and comfortable for a visiting family with teenagers. Great menu and a cozy heated patio. Reminds me of our local pub.  Great time good food.
author: Gerald P.

description: Was visiting friends in San Francisco, from Boston, and was looking for a bar in town to watch the Red Sox ALCS game.  My friends said this was the spot to go to for that, and they were right.  We got a table in the back room, and ordered a bunch of beers and some food.  Our server Bob was extremely fast, despite having a packed bar that night, and very funny & personable.  We ended up staying after the game ended for a few more rounds.  Would highly recommend this to anyone looking to watch the game.
author: Blake Y.

description: Awesome brew-pub style sports bar. Food is great, as is the service. Awesome place to catch a game and get 'hang over' cure food on a weekend morning...
author: Matthew S.

description: Our team ordered a couple pitchers of beer and plates of hamburgers.  After two beers, I asked for a glass of water and was told to go to the bar, or she had some other things to do and there would be a delay.  I said I would wait, please bring it.  Thanks for never bringing it.  Not sure how long a place can stay open with this poor customer service.  Definitely taking the business elsewhere.
author: Cherry F.

description:
Come here to watch the pats with pats fans, but not for the place itself. 

Our waiter was a high-strung diva built like a leprechaun. He would back dart around the room, gasping and sighing, at one point proclaiming "Why can't anyone push in their chairs! It's like I'm in a kindergarten!"

He wasn't. He was at a bar and he'd forgotten that the single table he was waiting on had three members with empty glasses.

I bypassed the waiter and went to the bar for drinks. The bartender ran my card on a separate check. Come Monday, I found out they over charged me by $4. 

I suppose it's typical, but they will include 18% gratuity if you have a large party.

The ATM is broken, and they will insist on using only 2 cards to split a large check.

There will be flies hovering around your food and drinks. If your team is losing, you count how many the bartender can swat with his dish rag.

I won't be back. There is a whole city full of better options then here.
author: Ryan P.

description:
I asked the bartender for our check as we were rushing to get to Anchor Steam for a tour.

"You're in a hurry? Well what do you expect when you come in with 10 people?"

WTF? Does this place NOT want our money? There are plenty of other places to eat.

The bartender then proceeded to add up our check, in his head. Including the SF Health Tax (5%!?) and tax. I waited around for him to finish.

When I looked it over to make sure it was ok, the waitress pointed "there's a calculator over there"

Screw this place. My sandwich was good. But you don't need to be treated this way. Go elsewhere.
author: Sachin A.

description:
Being fresh from Connecticut, and living in Potrero Hill I decided I had to at least check this place out. Since then I've been back with groups of friends several times, for it's nearby convenience. It's nothing fantastic, but its a decent dive bar to watch a sports game or one of the many good live shows they have. 

Nice little back porch area with plenty of foliage and some big heaters. The service is usually good, but being outside we were often forgotten about.

Good beer selection, typical bar food with average/above average prices. Haven't had food there very often, but when I do it's just okay, not quite worth the cost. If they had excellent food, this place would easily be a favorite local bar.
author: Chris G.

description:
I love this place. It's in the neighborhood, the staff and owners are fabulous and accommodating and the food is great with a fairly diverse menu. 

Relatively close to the ballpark, this remains my preference.
author: Quail T.

description: Came out here with friends last night. It's a cool bar; a nice vibe. A little on the smaller side, but an easy place near the office to grab a bite and a beer. Had nachos, the chicken fingers, and a salad. We all appreciated the quick service, the fact they split the checks, the drinks, and the laid back atmosphere. A little on the pricey side, but I would come here again.
author: Saroya W.

description:
typical bar/pub food.  the beer was not super cold, the wings were just ok and the food over priced.  

expect nothing here and you will have a good experience.  

That being said if you are a sports fan and there is a game of a local team playing this place would be a blast.
author: Brian R.

description:
My office is a few blocks away from this establishment, and I've dropped by a couple of times. I'd recommend, if just for the fries. Wow! I think they salt them with fairy dust or something. They're that yummy. 

Aside from that, I can report that the beers were tasty (as expected, not magically tasty) and the service was very good. I have not experienced a live show or sports-oriented event, so perhaps I'll wander over when the opportunity arises.
author: Janna M.

description: Taken here by local friends. Excellent choices of comfort food. Enjoyed my cheesesteak and cup of chowder, but was very envious of my friends choices; a dish called fowl play and a bowl of seafood gumbo! Now imprinted on my mind need to vome back soon and enjoy these dishes. Looks to be a excellent sports bar!
author: Clyde E S.

description: My dad and I stopped in here for a bite to eat before a show at Bottom of the Hill.  The waitress was just outright rude.  I asked for water and she never brought it.  I eventually got up, picked up the pitcher of water and poured my own water in front of her and another employee.  They just watched me do it and went back to talking.  We didn't complain about the poor service or act irritated in any way (she seemed like the kind of person that spits in food), but the service just got worse.  The food was average.  Good thing we didn't let her bad attitude ruin our night!
author: Megan H.

description: I've been here a few times and the service usually isn't great, but is passable. The last visit was a joke though. A Wednesday night, only semi-busy, and we were immediately seated and then promptly forgot about. For 25 minutes. Waiters walked by us but were mute to our calls and had their eyes glued to the TV, so it was impossible to make eye contact as well. We finally just got up and left without ever even getting a beverage, let alone a glass of water. I don't think they even noticed. So if you like watching waiters watch sports rather than taking your order, by all means, check out the Connecticut Yankee.
author: Melissa B.

description: I like the Yankee. I go there sometimes for lunch and it has a great atmosphere. There are a lot of business people, and everyone's there to eat and relax. A nice day in the city makes the patio the place to sit and relax. Their burgers are good, and i like the philly cheesesteak (aka Dr J).
author: Emory J.

description:
I must say, I have finally had my fill of this establishment's snotty and poor service.
let me add one caveat, their bartenders are all cool, and one of the servers is an excellent person and is always very nice to me and my kids----forget her name---she works on sunday, which is the day I bring my kids to watch the green bay packers----other than this exceptionally gracious
person, the remainder of their staff is beyond awful. I tip very well----even with the horribly rude members of their wait staff. no more, a few weeks back, I took my sons to watch the packers game which was on at the same time as the patriots game----the rude blonde waitress that we have had a half dozen times or more, with poor results always, was beyond rude---and her running mate that day was even worse. it was like they were doing US a favor by taking our order 45 minutes after we arrived---and then finally serving us in the middle of the third quarter of the game----my kids were starving.
I tapped her on the shoulder once to ask how our order was coming along, and she nearly bit my head off, saying something to the effect "you're no more special than our other customers, we only have one burner today to make the pancakes...blah, blah, blah".....she was actually pissed at me for asking!!!----lo and behold, a minute later our burnt and cold pancakes arrived along with our cold buffalo wings which we order dry with steve's buffalo sauce on the side----no buffalo sauce....we ask for the buffalo sauce and she literally threw a bottle of tapatio sauce at us----which, of course, is the furthest thing from buffalo sauce. I HAVE NEVER BEEN MORE ILL-TREATED AND INSULTED ANYWHERE IN MY ENTIRE LIFE THAN ON THAT DAY----and this critique includes their other extremely rude little hyper active jackrabbit A**hole who can't even stay with you long enough to take  your order correctly. I WILL NEVER GIVE THESE A**HOLES A DIME OF MY BUSINESS EVER----AND WILL SCREAM FROM THE MOUNTAINTOPS WHAT AN UTTER DISCRACE THIS PLACE IS----

Fortunately, I have re-discovered the KEZAR PUB---and will now tell all of my out of town friends the KEZAR PUB is THE sports bar destination in San Francisco.
author: Thomas B.

description:
Let's say your boyfriend's from Boston.

And let's also say you don't have a TV. And the Patriots are playing in a game that will decide whether or not they will go to the Super Bowl.

If this, then Connecticut Yankee would be a good spot to take said boyfriend to watch aforementioned game. There will lots of Pats fans here, and the crowd will help get him in the spirit.

Also, tasty mashed potatoes and a good selection of beers on tap and in bottles.
author: Miriam W.

description:
The perfect place to go when meeting up and catching up with an old friend.  Oh by the way, the name of that movie I was telling you about to put on your Netflix queue was "The Hanging Garden."   Never mind.

Anyways, that's precisely what happened earlier yesterday night.

This is exactly 3 1/2 stars, but because I haven't been to a decent place since this year began, I'm gonna push this up to four stars without much of a fight.  The service was perfect, quick, patient, friendly, reliable, and very key-yoot!

For San Francisco, the parking's excellent if you're there on a slow week night.  Inside, you have a rustic Victorian interior and a moderately social place to hang out at.  It's a great place to carry a conversation and the crowd's fun and uninvasive.

I also learned something funny tonight.  For all my life, I've been calling "Fat Tire" beer "Flat Tire" beer.  I had the first three Fat Tires of my life today and I can tell you, I won't shout out that typo again.

The food's honestly nothing to brag about, but better than pub grub I've had at other places and nothing was blatantly disgusting so hey, that's a plus.  The crab cakes just made the cut but the veggie burger was good.  

I've only been here once prior and I could swear that I thought the place was called "The Yankee Doodle Dandy" but then again, I've been calling "Fat Tire" beers "Flat Tire"...

I'll gladly come here again sometime and look forward to that day whenever it happens.  But that whole East Coast Baseball team concept?  Nah, I'm not buying into that hype.   I was happy enough with just the modestly decent  food and fresh salad to go with my beer to really hone in on the themes on what to call a burger or sandwich.


hmmm  a veggie burger; three beers; a salad.

"Make up your mind.  Are you gonna go healthy or are yah gonna clog your arteries????"

*slaps self in the head*
author: Tony U.

description:
being from New England, I will always have a soft spot in my heart for this place..  Truly, one of the most unique bars in the City.  If you like really good pub food and consistently GREAT live music, this place will not disappoint.

Fritz, the owner, is one of the nicest guys around.  He has a great philosophy for booking music- let the band keep 100% of the door.  This is unheard of.  While the Yankee is know primarily is an eating/drinking spot, it doubles as one of the coolest music venues in the city.  The staff won;t hesitate to call someone out on being a douche bag, but that's part of the charm.  Do yourself a favor and check this place out for sports games, stay for the food and live entertainment.
author: Fred T.

description:
Good place for a drink and a burger. Very friendly staff, the food was pretty good (bar food), and it was a fun crowd. 

Will definitely be back, although with a Lakers jersey rooting against the Celtics!!
author: Art A.

description: Super cheap drinks. Not the friendliest service. But what can I say? $6 Vodka on the rocks make me happy :)
author: Roderick S.

description: My 5 stars stems from being a homesick Bostonian seeking the presence of my fellow massholes.  If you're a Boston sports fan, look no further.  My boyfriend and I watched most of the Pats' regular season, the playoffs, and the Super Bowl here this year.  I couldn't have imagined a more fun and rowdy crowd to have watched the games with, it honestly felt like being in Boston.  This is our spot now.  And when in Rome, get the clam chowdah!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Food is disgusting here.  Don't waste your money on it.  Pub food doesn't have to always be bad.

As a bar, it's a fine atmoshere for watching a sporting event, especially if a New England or Boston area team is involved.
author: Mike B.

description: Nice pub in Potrero. Inside looks nothing like the inside. I think it's trying to resemble some kind of east coast hunting lodge or something. Good beer selection and the kitchen is surprisingly good. Good place to catch a football game.
author: Will D.

description: The best thing about this place is the outdoor seating. Sunny patio with picnic tables. Food is mediocre and pretty expensive for bar food. My very small Chinese Chicken Salad was $11, standard gin and tonic was $8. They don't have happy hour and the service was bad (not nice lady server at lunch). Although, we had a guy server for drinks in the late afternoon/evening who was very nice and on top of it. I probably won't go back, Thee Parkside (one block down) has $3 drinks at happy hour and outside seating. I love the history of the place, though (noted on the back of the menu). Cheers!
author: Karie S.

description:
Why is the food here so below par?!?!
Why do I keep coming here?!?!

My boyfriend and I were in salad craving mode from eating so damn much the last couple of nights.  It was Sunday 3pm and it seemed like every reasonable place that served large salads was closed in the mission, potrero area.  We really wanted to go to the brickhouse was it was shutting down, so we tried Axis cafe, closed, and decided that Connecticut Yankee was open.  

Both got the Tuna/Nicoise salad, which should be renamed.  For anyway who has had a Nicoise salad from France.  This one was a fail.  First off broccoli? WTF.  Then one slice of raw potato? WTF. 

The tuna was seared and over done and the dressing was balsamic greaseball.

Salads are not difficult to make and although I ate it all because I was starving.  This one was a total fail.

Needless to say, the outdoor seating area was really quite cute.
author: Skye W.

description:
Fritz and the gang do the "dive / sports" bar thing as good as it gets...
Throw in some decent jam bands at night, and all is well!
If you are looking for a French Laundry experience, you are in the wrong place, but if you want good pub grub and a fun environment... you found THE place!
author: petaluma d.

description:
Today, I walked in to the Connecticut Yankee and said two sentences, "I am having a shitty day, and you make really good BBQ sandwiches. Will you make me one?"

One lemonade, excellent pulled pork w/ slaw, and hot fudge brownie sundae later, the server said two sentences back to me, "We're buying your lunch. It's in the hopes that it makes your day better."

I am nine months pregnant and about a week from giving birth. I post this as a review, as a testament to the goodness of mankind.  And, most importantly, as an an acknowledgement of the surprising generosity and kindness of the people who work at and run this neighborhood place.   I am in awe.

Go to the Yankee. Buy their food. See their bands. Load up on their beer. And be sure to tip the staff really, really well -- they deserve it.
author: Leah H.

description:
A neighborhood sports bar/restaurant with outdoor seating.  

Hubby said he had lunch here with co-workers and was good so we ended here for dinner.  The dining room was empty but there were some patrons at the bar and outside.  We had our choice of tables.  Friendly service.  Menu has interesting reference to sports legends.

What we had:
OJ's buffalo wings - 8 pieces - $8.25 - very good.  Hot, crispy and not too much vinegar in sauce - 4 wings and  4 drumettes.  

The "Larry" Birdger - $9- 7 oz burger w/ choice of cheese (chedder, swiss or jack) served w/ grilled onions and "Yankee" fries. $1.50 for bacon - ok, greasy and medium instead of medium rare.  Fries are very crispy and yummy.

The Pee-Wee Herman - Carolina pulled pork sandwich w/ homemade  bbq sauce and slaw, - $8.75 - very messy, bun melted, pork has a bit of old oil taste.  bbq sauce very vinegary.

Had a taste of oj black bean soup - good so maybe gumbo is a contender.

About 10-12 drafts - $5/pint.
author: Gloria H.

description: Went for the Patriots/Ravens playoff game here. I think they had two waitresses working on what must have been the busiest day of the year. This was clearly insufficient wait staff, though they tried. Bigger issue was that the food was the quality of Jack in the Box or worse. Not worth any kind of wait, and when next in the hood will definitely go elsewhere.
author: Jessica H.

description: This is no Boston bar, any place that will not put the volume on for game seven of the Bruins playoffs should be embarrassed to call themselves a Boston/New England Bar!  Was hoping for a place to watch New England sports but I will never return to this little dump.  Also they have a licence plate outside on the wall that says #1 Red Sox fan but when you walk in there is a big San Fran Giants 2010 Champions banner.  I did not notice any Red Sox 2004 or 2007 banner.  Complete Shananagins!  Never again.
author: Ethan L.

description: Just had Sunday brunch at the Yankee.  Great chicken Caesar salad and friendly service. I highly recommend the Irish coffee it rivals the BV. Make sure Ed makes yours.
author: Sheigla M.

description:
If I lived in Potrero...or anywhere close to Potrero, I think this would be a regular spot. It's a cute little spot with a very chill and laid-back vibe; nobody is in any particular rush...which can be a good and bad thing.

I only had drinks but it looked like they had a decent pub menu. The drinks were relatively cheap (beers for $4.50). The large back room is great for a big group, and there's also a back patio. I was there at night, so I didn't head out to the patio but any place that has outdoor seating is great.

When I was there on a Saturday night, it was pretty quiet; seems like the kind of place you would go to have a beer with a pal or to maybe watch games (a number of TVs around the bar).

Generally, it's a fine place though there's nothing that particularly stands out about the spot.
author: Wendy L.

description:
NOM NOM NOM NOM...... Yeah That's me eating good food at a sports bar no less! 

I love this place not only for the food and tasty brews but, hell I'm from Boston and this place plays all my favorite sports teams HELLZ YEAH BITCHES!!
author: Stephen L.

description:
First of all, I am not a fan of baseball or football, so skip this review if you are looking for recommendations  on watching your favorite AMERICAN sport at a local bar. I came to watch tennis on a Sunday full of football fans, and low and behold my girlfriend and I were treated to a private corner with the TV tuned into the Australian Open.
 I called ahead, and Ed the bartender was gracious and accommodating. 
I did not have such luck at several bars in town. Due to the football season, most bars only show what the majority, i.e.men, like. 
The food is fair, for a bar. We liked the key lime pie. I gave CY 4 stars for being kind to tennis fans.
author: julie s.

description:
I enjoyed this experience!! Quite a few of us came here looking for some lunch and fun. I loved the outside patio (although you cant smoke) This location is in a warmer part of the city so the sun was abundant!! Between all of us we tried several dishes. The pork Sandwich was good (not to dry or saucy). The Wings were ok, but i have a thing about wings tasting like Tabasco. The chicken strips were more fried in a Panko, and was very good, but kinda small. The taco salad was order and it was LARGE(worth the money). Other salads were order and all were good size and flavor. 

There was a Margarita that everyone keep ordering of the special drink menu, they were done nicely. I will say that I ordered the Bloody Mary, and hated it. It was too peppery, too spicy, not enough vodka and frankly a disappointment.

ALL-N-ALL: I would go back, great for large parties, food was de-lish and not too expensive, and the Patio in itself was worth the trip!!
author: Heather P.

description:
What irks me most about the Connecticut Yankee is how much potential it has.  It has history and a nice outdoor dining area in a part of town without a lot of other similar choices.  I work nearby so I've been there several times for lunch.

The food is OK, if somewhat greasy.  The "S" sauce (ask for if not at your table) is pretty decent and a welcome change from the usual condiment options. The salads are kinda on the large size, the burgers and other sandwiches on the smaller side.  The fries are pretty good. 

The service, however, is dismal and the main reason we don't go there for lunch unless we are absolutely sick of everything in the area and don't want to drive.  Nearly every time we've been there someone in our group gets snapped at by a waiter for what we think is a fairly trivial (if any!) offense.   Or we get forgotten for a half hour.  If we ask for an extra fork or something you'd think we just asked them to swim to china to get a new one for us.

I've been working in the area for over three years now and we buckle down and go there about once every six months thinking, surely the service is better now.  Every time we walk back to work laughing at our selves for needing to be reminded of why it's not part of our normal lunch rotation.

pity, because I really WANT to like CY and have a good outdoorsy place to get a burger on a sunny day.  Instead, I head to nearby Axis cafe.
author: William F.

description:
I love me a good dive bar!  Connecticut Yankee is right near my office, so some coworkers and I decided to try it out.  It's quite a comfy environment with fun, quirky staff.  Totally will be back!

Drinks: They had an array of beers including Anchor Steam, Blue Moon, Stella, Fat Tire, and some IPA....you get the gist...there's something for everyone.

Food: The hot wings were really not as tasty as toro e.'s picture led me to believe, but they were still yummy.  The fries were the best, but the onion rings were string-style rather than the thick meaty ones.

I'll be back!!!
author: Fontane L.

description: aged and fresh ugly blue corner...local sports bar restaurant...sports memorabilia and "junk" decorations...casual environment...limited selection of $five pints..cheaper pbr, bud and domestic...taking a guinness $five and another...served to the table...taking a larry birdger burger medium rare...finding burger quite large and surprisingly cooked to an exact medium-rare on a busy sf 49er vs. ny giants sunday...standard large filling burger and side of coleslaw...containing strong creamy mayonnaise and mustard flavors...extremely little tang, sweet or salt...side of fries and finding a heavy crispy coating...harder fries if liking...watching, eating and drinking...wobbling tables and seated anywhere possible...$fifteen liter of house red or white wine the cheapest drinking option and taking near end...house red quite sweet and fruity...easy drinking...crowded sunday with an unfortunate 49ers loss to the giants 20 - 17 in overtime...
author: Hen A.

description: Came for a weekend lunch.  Good no-frills club sandwich and salads, good drinks, sunny patio, nice people - what's not to like?
author: Josh C.

description:
I have a friend who lives a few doors down from Connecticut Yankee.  I have parked directly across from the bar on numerous occasions, and I have always enjoyed pretending not to peek at the patrons seated on the patio.  Still, I never had a reason to drop by and check it out for myself.

However, last weekend the four of us had a minor dilemma: we wanted to watch the Cal/Stanford game and the Oregon/Arizona game at the same time.  What turned out to be the biggest problem of them all, the Cal/Stanford game was on Versus, the exclusive, elusive channel available only to Comcast subscribers.  Following an all-out Yelp/iPhone offensive and what could only be described as a sports bar scavenger hunt throughout San Francisco, we found ourselves at Connecticut Yankee.  Yep, we visited three sports bars in SoMa, 2 sports bars in North Beach and called a dozen more only to end up 1/4 of a block away from where we started.  If only I were kidding.

By the time we settled in for an evening of Pac-10 football, we were tired, annoyed and hungry.  We didn't even care that the Cal game was on a big TV that was far from our table, and the Oregon game was on a smaller TV perched atop the bar.  We were watching two games, and the food was on the way.

It's a good neighborhood bar with friendly service and decent food options.  As a Yankees fan, I found it a bit difficult to ignore the "vote for Papi" stickers and the framed newspaper article entitled "FINALLY!"  I knew it was a Red Sox bar, and I can respect that. You probably won't see me watching baseball games here, however.  To be fair, they did have a photo of Babe Ruth in Yankees uniform, as well as a beautiful photo of Mr. Steinbrenner, Reggie Jackson and Thurman Munson.  Not bad for a New England bar.

Driving all over San Francisco left us downright famished.  While my friends opted for the Wade Boggs (chicken breast, of course), I was on a mission to find something that did not have a cute Red Sox name.  Enter Saturday Special: prime rib dinner for $19.  I complemented it with a green salad with vinaigrette for $5 more.  The prime rib dinner was surprisingly good.  Granted, my expectations were really low, but the prime rib was much better than expected.  It was at least a 20-oz piece of prime rib, served almost medium rare.  It wasn't "steakhouse quality," but it wasn't "bar quality" either.  I finished all of it, along with the mashed potatoes and string beans.

A couple of hours later, I ordered a brownie with vanilla ice cream for dessert.  I would advise you to skip this, since this dessert had more sugar and fat than flavor.  For $5.50 it was also not a good value.

We left the bar right after the games ended.  At about 8:30, some band began preparing the stage for their 9 pm performance, and the lead singer was blocking our view at times.  Can't speak to the quality of the music, but I am sure it was quite wonderful.

Given the proximity to my friend's house, easy parking, numerous food options and a nice patio, I could definitely see myself going back to Connecticut Yankee again and again.  I promise to leave my Yankees hat in the car.
author: Yan G.

description:
Great spot to hit during lunch on a work day!
I loved their pulled pork sammich and with it a glass of Fat Tire Amber Ale.
They were also very accommodating of our large group of 10 peeps and we all had a great time.
Can't wait to go back!
author: Keika L.

description:
Nigel is one of those endearing assholes that can also make a mean manhattan. He's the man... all I gotta say. And yes, wearing fishnets is asking for trouble; why else were they invented? 

The martinis are served to perfection as well with pre chilled glasses and frozen vodka which is a little surprising coming from a "sports bar". 

Clientele leaves something to be desired but I left, found a boy  a block down the street at Bottom of the Hill and dragged him back with me.  b.y.o.b. (bring your own boy) single ladies!! The aging divorcee enjoying his $19 prime rib special aint gonna cut it. No offense.

Speaking of which, clean bathrooms (well cleaner than b.o.t.h. and parkside) that were accommodating if you catch my drift. 

Connecticut Yankee you will always hold a special place in my heart for making a rather ordinary sat night in october one of my fav stories. bff 'kay?
author: dr S.

description:
Best Turkey burger I've had in a while!  The buffalo wings and nachos were on fire too! Conn. Yankee is a no frills bar with good food and easy manner folks.  

The English lad in the group says he likes the locale as it reminds him of a British Pub. Our Indiana lass found all the sports memorabilia endearing and Larry Bird photos homey. Our Russian girl loved the burgers and hearty foods they served.  As for me, I was just wanting a place that'd accommodate our large group with fast service to make everyone's tummy happy quickly. Purpose fulfilled. Everybody loves Conn. Yankee.
author: Jackie G.

description: I've been here multiple times after softball games and every time we get the blonde haired girl she is so rude and always acts like she is being bothered by business. The same goes for the older gentleman with the glasses and gray hair. Your bar is located by a softball field and I'm pretty sure the players spend a lot of money there. I've been a server and for them to treat us so horrible even when we say please and thank you is just bad business. I hesitate even tipping these servers because they are that bad. I've gotten better service at McDonalds. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and I suggest you go to parkside for drinks after games. If I could give negative stars on service I would.
author: Lynn Y.

description: Great bar right next to Anchor Brewing.  The bar has some old school character with dark wooden floors and old antique bar.  There is outdoor picnic table seating for those days when you feel like soaking up a little sun.  We sat outside and ordered a couple burgers and beers.  The club sandwich and garlic fries were fantastic.  Huge portions and garlic to die for.  They've got about 10 beers on tap, but if you are this close to Anchor gotta have the Liberty Ale or Porter.  Great service and good prices.
author: Brad R.

description:
In my never ending search for the ultimate wings, I traveled to the yankee where I had gone 10 year prior. the wing sauce is very good, nice color, and texture. The right amount of spicy/tangy flavor. 
The problem is the wings themselves were small, deformed or otherwise looking sick. It might have been due to the heavy demand of during playoff season that caused a run on wings in San Francisco, I'll have to go back and try again. The wings looked like grade C-D, and they were small. Not the tiny ones some places serve, but a cut above them. Recommendation is for the sauce and not the wings. Celery was also lacking.  If your downtown, the "Old Ship" on battery gets my vote. Kezar pub if you have friends or are really hungry.
author: Mike B.

description:
While I really like the outdoor patio, I wouldn't recommend coming here for anything other than drinking on it. Or, sitting inside to watch a game and drinking... just make sure you don't sit in the back room. It smells like a combination of dirty shoes and overflowing bathroom. Really, I wanted to shake the people sitting back there- "What are you thinking, Man, you're eating amongst these smells?? Have you no decency, or just no sense of smell and an amazing ability to control your gag reflex??!" But mostly I just wanted to get out of there, ASAP- the 2 guys with me even reacted the same way, so I know it wasn't just my amazing female sense of smell picking this up. Anyway, we opted for the outdoor heated patio after that, a nice enough place to sit.

Food was all around mediocre. Don't get bread- it's just not worth it. I thought it would go nicely with my soup, and to the extent that my veggie soup of the day was also quite bland and not very good, I guess it did. Friends also didn't really like their food. 

Overall, don't bother eating here. Just drink.
author: Kristen L.

description: the burgers are good but retardedly pricey. the bloody marys are small and pricey, nothing to write home about.  nice patio for a nice day.  service is iffy.
author: Matt N.

description:
Its hard to say too many bad things about the Yankee. But the truth is on weekends they are always understaffed and the service can really suck. If you are smart enough to go over to the bar instead of waiting at your table then you will get a drink but if you wait it could be a very long time.  

The food is pricey but good for bar food. 
NY steak = always cooked med rare and tasty.
The fries =   dipped in sugar then deep fried.
The fried chicken = holy crap the gravy is for people who like to pack. on the calories and yes I'm that guy.
Burger = fresh patties and always delicious. 
Chinese Chicken Salad = the dressing is top secret and very good.
Wings = if you like um spicy then here you go
Chowder = watery and not enough clams, skip it
Nachos = good for those who don't eat meat but not good for those who like good nachos, skip it.

They also have a couple of high chairs for the folks with babies. 

This is a good neighborhood bar not a destination.
author: Joseph M.

description: having recently discovered this place in my hood, i thought i would give it a try.  the place was not full but the service was awful.  it was difficult to get a glass of water or a clean spoon, the one at the table was dirty.  i had the vegetarian chili, which was served warmish and it was also greasy.  the french fries were like the ones made from mashed potatoes and formed into fries.  it has a lot of potential, but i won't be back.
author: caveat e.

description: Great Bar.  Good food. Fresh.  Great prices on the food.  Nice atmosphere.  Feels like an old time bar.  Has live music every now and then.  Flat screen TVs for sport.  You have an outdoor area for when you want to sit outside.  Bartenders and owner, Fritz, good solid people.  Happy to have this as a part of Potrero Hill.  If you don't like this bar, well too bad.  Probably not meant for you.
author: Mike H.

description: A place that serves fat ass Hennessy shots for cheap will always get a million stars!!!
author: Doug F.

description: Comfort food, alcohol, and live music. What more do you need?
author: Evan W.

description:
Love the CY.  I come here after all my softball games at Jackson Park.  Staff is friendly and always seem to be having fun. Food is solid bar food (seriously people, what did you expect).  Fritz, the owner is obviously very passionate about his establishment.  Music on Thursdays is always good.  

It's one of the few bars in town (Pittsburghs in the Outer Sunset also comes to mind) that are true dives.  Not a dive for the sake of calling itself that to be cool.  Not a run down bar.  Just a no frills drinking establishment.  Love it.
author: David E.

description: Went there the evening of Dec. 7. Food was ok, bartender was pretty cool, but waitress was terrible! Sat my brother and I at a table, went to check on someone else, then came back all pissy, asking if we sat ourselves! (Signs clearly say 'Please do NOT seat yourself') She was the one who led us to the table! Ordered a beer, she walked off before the second order at our table was taken, took about 25 minutes to take food order, then rarely saw her again. She seemed put out to get mustard and a pitcher of beer for us. I don't know if that is 'east coast attitude', but I think we'll go somewhere else next time we're in the city for a rock show.
author: Paul B.

description: Service..  or sorry, lack there of.  Stinky, tacky place, but perfect for a sports bar/live music.  Food is super marginal.  Great place to belly up and watch some tv by yourself.  This place could be so much more.  Sleepy, sad little place that could be a fun spot.  No motivation for a better establishment.  But I guess it is what it is.  You decide.
author: Jeff N.

description: I'm fan because it's divey and it makes me feel like I stepped back in time to a old sailors saloon. The Giants are usually playing on the big screen which lets me know I'm in the modern era, because I don't think pirates had HD TV. The food is ok, it's not gourmet for sure. Yet, it's good if you want a cheeseburger or fries before a concert at The Bottom of the Hill. Good drinks and a salty atmosphere. Aye matey!
author: Sheila T.

description:
Holy comfort food heaven!!! How can you go wrong with a restaurant that has a sandwich called "The Pee Wee Herman"?!?! 

I had the french onion soup and it was probably the best I've ever had. Most places use too much or not enough salt. This one was perfect. I also had the bbq pork sandwich. Now if you have read any of my other reviews you know I am hard to please in the bbq department. This however, was heaven!! My husband's comment of "I've never seen you clean your plate with such voractiy" should tell you how I liked it :). The Bloody Mary's were awesome and the fries were perfect. 

One of the best parts of Connecticut Yankee is the decor/memorabilia. If you are from New England you will LOVE this place!!! The walls are covered in old magazine covers and autographed pics of all Boston teams.

Why only 4 stars you ask??? It's a little pricey, we spent about $75 for two sandwiches, 3 bloody's and a soup. Also it's in BFE Potrero. Fortunately there's an abundance of parking nearby. Overall it was really good and I will go back...probably many times.
author: Kandace K.

description:
I just want to thank the peeps at Connecticut Yankee for all their friendly service for my boyfriends birthday party.

When i called to make reservations i was informed that i could only reserve the private party room. They also told me that if the tables outside were open that we could move outside, which we did. 

From the beginning the management and the staff were helpful and friendly.  The food was good and the drinks kept coming. When the bill came we were pleasantly surprised with how reasonable the bill was even with gratuity added in. 

It's not easy to deal with 20 drunk hairdressers. I had to give our server a little more since she was sweet and attentive. 

Thanks.
author: john m.

description:
When you live in the Lower Potrero, there aren't that many places to walk to to get a drink and a snack. Particularly not a chill place with a back patio.

I went here on a beautiful Saturday afternoon. The service was sassy, the drinks were refreshing, and it wasn't crowded, not in the least.

The gals who work there are young and brash and I like that.
author: Rachel F.

description: Watch NY kick ass in the super bowl here and it was over crowded in a good way... the bartender was amazing given he was the only one pouring... food was tasty... Great crowd mostly east coast crowd, we loved the salads and great selection of fresh local beers... Bigger TV's would be nice or more of them..
author: Daniel L.

description: This place was pretty good. I pass by it daily and never gave it much thought but some friends raved about the burgers so we decided to give it a shot for dinner. A nice dive-y local feel which I love when done right. Friendly, attentive service and they have great bar food. The chicken wings were spicy and cooked just right. Everyone that ordered a burger looked like they were in heaven. I had the turkey burger and some wonderful crispy french fries. When you go don't forget to put their special sauce on your burger I think they call it "Steve's Special Sauce" it made a great addition.
author: Shannon H.

description:
I spend more money on one Sunday in September at this place that it would cost me to buy the Sunday NFL package on satellite. But the crowd of New England regulars keeps me coming back for Pats games.

The veggie burger is really good. Fair priced beer.  Nice patio, I'm told, because there is no tv outside.  I like the bartender, even though he's a Steelers fan.

No shame having a 10am drink here at kickoff.  On Sunday morning, you're on east coast time, and amoung low-key friends.
author: Jim N.

description:
It's about the chill ambience: 
- cool back patio for drinks & noms in the sun
- no-nonsense bar w/ tables inside for when you're looking for a cas' hang with some friends
- some good live music on weekends
- I like their Cobb salad -- my usual order

CT Yankee always delivers on those things, which for me is all I ask. And for that I'm a fan and I give four stars!
author: Lorna M.

description:
This is what I call a solid neighborhood bar, albeit a sports one. Very friendly staff make this a nice place for a casual meal. Nothing fancy necessarily, but think tasty wings, burgers, that sort of thing, and all with like The Larry Birdger and the Ty Cobb Salad. On that note their salads are really actually pretty decent, and I've heard wonderful things about their chowder, good for cold nights like we're in right now.

The bar is slathered in sports paraphernalia and on game days, the place is pretty slammed. I've come with my sporty friends and watched many a game here. 

When the weather permits, their outside patio is a cool way to while away the hours, and their solid beer selection (they carry Lagunitas and Poppy Jasper, two of my favorites) will please most.

For better Potrero Hill, this is definitely a great bar, and actually one of the only ones for the 30-something set. I've also started my nights before a show at Bottom of the Hill here, not a bad way to fuel up for a big night of music.

Oh, I like the fact that the name Connecticut Yankee gives off a certain New England vibe while also indicating the cross street that the bar is on.
author: Nish N.

description:
I was here on Sunday for the back to back Pats/Sox extravaganza.  The place was pretty empty when I first got there since most Niners and Pats fans were probably at the game.  Lots of TVs and they had the Pats/Niners game on several of them, the TB/White Sox playoff game as well as the Denver game for the lone fan there.  I was quite enjoying myself (although they were out of a few types of beer...ie Sam Adams light!?!?)

Eventually I ordered food just before the Sox game started and the burger was good.  The fries were just meh.  My companions order the hot wings and they were delish...except for the blue cheese which was on the watery side.  The service was efficient...I wouldn't say it was rude like some others have mentioned.  

Just as we were finishing, this place got bombed with all the Pats fans coming from the game to watch the Red Sox.  Now *most* of these people were already trashed before they got there...can you see where this is going...?

It got so crowded and people started getting biosterous and impatient with the staff which was COMPLETELY overwhelmed at this point.  Lots of complaining and lots of whining.  Needless to say, I felt very sorry for them and can't take anything away for that.

I had great expectations for this Red Sox bar, but the comraderie and the mutual love for the Sox was just missing on this night.  I'm used to hugging and high fiving complete strangers...just cuz we all love the Sox.  The crowd was *SO* not like that.  I was disappointed to say the least.  I will give this place another shot...on a day when it's not full of already trashed Pats fans.
author: Angela N.

description:
One star for Celtic's win over Lakers and one more for the screaming fans in the back room. ( It's us!)

The food is not what you should come here for especially the $8.95 ( Four piece chicken strips ). The burger is OK, but not worth $11 bucks. I'm not cheap as many of you may know. I enjoy a great meal and a great fucking fantastic parties. Many of you should know how I do it, even the food is gourmet. 

I came here with some friends after the Haight St. Faire, thinking lots of Celtics fans and lots of people. The place was dead. The only people that made this bar poppin, I think was us. I think if it was my bar, I would hire more attentive servers and better quality of food. I would also serve happy hour specials for Boston area fans. Come on, it's a celebration of 21 plus years since they last won the title. 

Go Celtics! BEAT LA!
author: Stanley K.

description:
I tend to not be confused by a lot of things but the Connecticut Yankee is one of them. I have this love hate relationship with this place that makes me really ambivalent about it when my co-workers suggest going there for lunch. 

LOVE
It's the closest place to my work where I can have a beer or two during lunch to take the edge off.

HATE
The food here really isn't that great. I've come here a lot for lunch and none of the sandwiches really excite me. It's always a search for "well, that doesn't sound so bad..." I think the dinner menu is slightly better than lunch because they server chicken fingers and buffalo wings at dinner (please do this for lunch!!!)

LOVE
The fries are really golden and crispy. The small(er) Cobb Salad isn't a bad deal. 

HATE
Sometimes they give you bread, sometimes they don't. I still haven't figured it out.

LOVE
Tons of TVs to watch sports on. The owner likes to play ping pong DVDs. 

HATE
Me and my co-worker are the only chinks in the place and the owner asks us which ping pong DVD we want to see. What? Just because I came in with tiny shorts and a ping pong paddle doesn't mean I know ANYTHING about ping pong (though I hear it should be called table tennis).

LOVE
The outdoor area is pretty nice to enjoy a few drinks (and a cigarette) on a sunny day during lunch or after work.

HATE
The service is hit or miss. Love it or hate it. 

Oh Yankee...
author: Patrick L.

description:
Meh for sure.  I just went to CY for lunch with some co-workers.  The lunch left us feeling very underwhelmed to say the least.

One Star for outdoor seating - which is nice to take advantage of in SF when it's actually sunny and hot out.  One Star is for the salads on the menu which are actually good.  

Now for what was bad:  3 of my colleagues ordered specials of the day which you would hope would be something great.  Well surprise, they were terrible and expensive!

One coworker ordered the special linguine dish for $11, another the fish and chips for $10 and another the french dip for $10.  The fish and chips arrived and looked like store bought frozen and battered fish that had been fried.  The french dip arrived with no accompaniment and the pasta arrived in a small bowl (like your standard small dish at home about 5 in diameter) with no accompaniments.  When asked about accompaniment for french dip waitress said oh, i'll bring your fries (10 min later).  We didn't ask about the pasta but we did ask for bread which she brought (10 min later).  Typically when you order a special you would expect to receive something little more such as grilled veggie, side salad, french fry or bread at a minimum - it wasn't like it was a huge dish of pasta, not adequate.  Meat in the french dip was also not very appealing and not easy to eat.  When coworker told the waitress that he could eat about two more bowls of pasta (not very big see pic) she replied with oh...people usually say it's the perfect amount.  Somehow I find this hard to believe.  I also think the guy in the kitchen may have been a little off.  Seems like the dishes were missing their sides with staff not caring or knowing.  

Good for beers and burgers and sunshine - salads good too but not much else and $$$ for what you get.
author: Shannon B.

description:
Tasteless jokes being passed around at our table while one member from our group bravely orders the "Pee Wee Herman Sandwich" which is humorously a "pulled" pork sandwich.

"How's the pulled pork.  Is it soft and tender or firm to the bite?"

"Uh, I'll take the Pee Wee Herman Sandwich, but hold the special sauce"

"The sandwich could also be chicken with artichoke hearts, aka choked chicken"

This went on for about 20 minutes while enjoying their decent selection of beers on tap.  This is the first sports bar I've been to out here in the Bay Area where it is headquarters for another areas sports teams, New England to be exact.  Wall to wall sox and pats memorabillia, not my thang but great for east coast transplants.
author: D.wight L.

description:
In a city with so many wonderful eateries and watering holes, why would you ever bother going to a mediocre one like this? The food? It's ok. The drinks? They're ok. The service? It's ok.

You're better off going to Friday's.. At least that way you can comfortably settle into your seat at the table or bar and revel in the medicority of it all rather than engage yourself in a futile existential debate over what makes Connecticut Yankee special, and if it's not special, why are you there.. in fact, why are you here in the first place, why are we all here, is there a grander purpose to it all, did your parents really love you, and where the hell are your god damn buffalo wings?!
author: Tal K.

description:
For those that want to watch America's favorite teams, Red Sox, Patriots,   Celtics and maybe the Revolution, The Connecticut Yankee is a great spot as the bar is geared particularly towards Boston and San Francisco sports watching.  There is plenty of seating so if you are looking for a bigger alternative to the Boston Sports Bar, Buccaneer, and also a place for food, The Connecticut Yankee is a great spot.  It's more of a sit down and eat/drink place than a standing and yelling at the T.V. every time Brian Scalabrine gets the ball type bar.  For a standing and yelling at the T.V. bar, the Buc is your best best.

Though I wouldn't go to The Connecticut Yankee just for food, it's very good for bar food.  If I had to rate the food here like a restaurant, I would give it a solid three, but as far as bar food goes, it's a four rating.  The chicken tenders, nachos, and burgers are all good. 

I had a chance to try brunch today at The Connecticut Yankee during a Celtics game and was impressed by some of the choices on the menu.  I ordered the stuffed French toast, which I enjoyed though not for the calorie counter as there might have been the equivalent of a small stick of cream cheese inside mixed with raspberry jam.  The potatoes were also nicely seasoned.  I would order both dishes again.  

For eating, drinking, and watching Boston sports, The Connecticut Yankee is a great spot.
author: Josh K.

description:
So.... I just went here tonight to watch a UCONN (ie, University of CONNECTICUT) basketball game, thinking that there MIGHT be a good vibe going on there or something.  I walk in and see the TVs everywhere, and I think "cool, this is a sports bar like I thought".  WRONG.  I was expecting something of Old Pro (palo alto) caliber.  WRONG.  I go to a waiter and ask where I can sit to watch the game.  They (the CONNECTICUT yankee) said "what game?".  I then point to my UCONN jacket.  and they go "oh, I don't know which TV it's on... lemme see".  Turns out all the TVs in the main room have the sound off, and everyone's just eating dinner in the main room.  WTF?  The sound is only on in the BACK room where they try to hide the people there to watch sports.  All THREE of us.  So I take this in stride.  There was also a distinct lack of New England pride going on....

This alone I can deal with.  I sit down and open the menu.  I see a chowdah.  So I order a chowdah.  IT SUCKED.  ALL cream, not much sherry, not much clam, not much spice... NOT MUCH but cream.  BIG thumbs down.  The tuna salad I got was OK--quite huge, and did a good job of filling me up.  Tuna could have been less dry--cooked a little more rare, but oh well.  Next time I'll just get a "Birdger"

So the food was decent, except for the crappy chowdah.  They had a good selection of beers on tap (though nothing like Amnesia or the Toronado), but there was no CT vibe...  yes, it looked like a New England bar, but... it wasn't someplace that should be called CT yankee.  Maybe Boston Tea Partier or some crap.

Man, wish the Old Pro were up here in SF.  That place had the most kickass pulled pork....  and it was MEANT to be someplace to watch a sports game.
author: Fong L.

description:
An incredibly realistic recreation of an average suburban bar in any city from Ansonia to Wilton. The outside design, the long tables inside, pitchers of Sam Adams, and Patriots and Red Sox gear from top to bottom give this place an eerie realism that's only appreciated by someone who actually lived in Connecticut.

Now some of you may be saying, "So what, there's tons of New England-themed bars in this city. What's the big deal?" Very true, but there's a world of difference between New England and just Connecticut. New England represents all kinds of stuff. From the Lobsters up in Maine to cheese in Vermont to Cape Cod and Boston in Massachusetts, it represents quite a large chunk of Americana. Connecticut, however, represents a couple of Indian casinos and a plot of land that you have to drive through to get from Massachusetts to New York. It's the land of Martha Stewart, Joe-mentum and crooked game show contestants.

But enough cracking on the Nutmeg State. Truth is, we kid because we love. The Connecticut Yankee may be puzzling to someone who's never spent summers in West Haven scarfing down lobster rolls or traveling from city to city just to find out what they call big sandwiches there (Could be a hoagie, wedge, roll, sub, grinder or poorboy), but that's the charm of it. This is a theme bar that transports you to a place you had no idea you ever wanted to go to but should. It's a big fat slice of the suburban northeast right in the middle of San Francisco, which is weirdly interesting when you think about it.

Service and beer selection are average at the Yankee, and if they were any better it would take away from the authentic Long Island Harbor feel of the place.

So take a trip back east by stopping off at the Connecticut Yankee (especially this fall when Pats games start up). It's like all the fun of Stamford without having to drive through Bridgeport to get there.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Mmmm beer. Pilsner Urquell on tap, which is never a bad choice.

The bar food was okay. There's some benches on the patio which are pretty cool. I sat with some nice people . I must dock a star for being a New England establishment though. I bleed Yankee Blue and seeing the  Red Sox World Series newspapers broke my heart a little.

Either way, if you're looking for a cool place to hang out around Potrero Hill, it's hard to go wrong with Connecticut Yankee.
author: Ryan V.

description:
If it wasn't for that cranky bipolar waitress, I would have given this place 4 stars. The fries were amazing---crispy, fresh and thin. The philly cheesesteak was yummy and on the spicy side, while the ambiance was fun and laid back.
But again, that waitress....she was just so rude. Talking down upon some of the teenagers there and telling some people when and when to not use utensils? I just wanted to throw ice in her face, but I couldn't stoop down a level. She included tip in the bill so we were FORCED to tip her. I don't think i'd go back if she was there. But the good side...pretty good bar food.
author: Alexa M.

description:
I really should hate this place.  As a native New Yorker I was raised from a young age to despise Boston and all things from there.

But this is a great neighborhood hangout.  I don't go in there to drink but the burger is phenomenal.  Also they do a cheesesteak that I love (even though a true Philadelphian would spit it out in disgust...so it's not authentic...it tastes good....get over it).  The dishes have cutesy names and the menu itself is written tongue in cheek  and is an amusing read.  As far as cutesy names: The Larry Bird-ger...the Dr. J (Philly cheesesteak) the Rico Petrocelli (Italian sub)...etc.  I think they do some funny stuff about Barry Bonds too, just to prove that it's not all  New Englandy.

The outdoor patio is a great although some bitch complained about them letting dogs out back so now I have to tie Sonny up outside and he whines...I wish I knew where she lived.

The owner is obviously a big jam band fan so I think most of the staff are also of the "String Cheese Incident" ilk, but I don't go there for the music....and am only a little afraid that someones gonna slip a tab of acid into my beer.

Think I'm gonna go get a Bird-ger right now.
author: Jay W.

description: I don't care what anyone else says! this place is a gem! it is what it is. Sure, the food is ok, and some of the staff ban be less attentive at time but for me I get a happy feeling coming to this place. It's a classic SF joint. Plain and simple.
author: Stephen G.

description: Bar in the local neighborhood and serves most of the locals around the area.  Food is expensive for bar food and mediocre.  I also experienced some poor service by a waiter.  They wanted me to buy food over a certain limit or had to give up my seat during the game.  I've never been in a bar where that was a rule.  To bad because I really wanted to be a regular and they lost some future business tonight.
author: Dave B.

description:
Havent been in a couple years, but I used to live on the south slope of Potrero Hill and frequented this place often. We used to kid around that the Anchor Steam on tap was piped in straight from the brewery up the road... Fresh as could be! Liberty Ale! One of the best on planet earth!

The clam chowder was tasty (with a drizzle of sweet vermouth!)...

The beer battered fries are the best!

Even after not being a regular, and after a few years absence, Doc would remember me! That makes you feel pretty good.

Last visit with my daughter, we ran into an old friend from San Fran and his family that we hadnt seen in years! We had a great time having dinner and beers and catching up.

Great place to start or end your night before or after seeing some live music a block away at Bottom of the Hill!

Always enough street parking and Ive never had a bad experience!
author: Bryan F.

description:
I have to admit that I hadn't been here in awhile, but remember that it's a great place to watch the game and grab some grub.  We had a surprise party for our friend here the other night and Nick and the crew were great.  They were easy to work with, took care of everything we needed and made sure that the booze was pouring at a constant speed.

We brought in our own band, some snacks and birthday cake and didn't have to spend a fortune for the place.  We do like the booze to flow so I'm sure that made it worthwhile.
author: Mabelle A.

description:
Food is meh, service is poor. The patio is nice for drinking, but honestly, there is no reason to come here when Parkside is right down the street with a better patio, way nicer staff and--shockingly--better food. 

Sorry CT. Maybe if you didn't make people wait 40 minutes for water, forget their orders, leave them outside for an hour without clearing their plates, offered affordable and better-tasting food, etc. this would be a cool neighborhood spot. Oh, and I've been here at least six times bc I keep hoping that the bad service is a fluke, but at this point, I have to call it a trend.
author: Emily F.

description:
Don't let the 'yankee' in the name fool you, this place is all new england, all the time. (yes, yes... king arthur's court...)

I caught one of the AL wildcard games here last year (go sox) on a sunday morning.  The food was O.K., but it was the little slice of new england that really was the draw.  Don't try to get there just as a game starts, because you'll have to fight with non-sportsfans (???) for seating. 

Maybe its a draw for potrero hill residents, but you shouldn't trek all the way over there unless you're there to see the sox or the pats.   There's some good memorabilia up on the walls, and if you're a sox fan, you have to go at least once.
author: james s.

description: I love this place.  The bartenders are super nice and hilarious.  This is by far the least pretentious bar in the city.  The food is also very good.  But mostly, I love the atmosphere and the people.  A great place to watch sports, too!
author: Katie F.

description:
5 stars for Sunday Football games and drinks... 1 star for food

I love going to the Connecticut Yankee on Sundays because they get all the games and have no problem putting on the Chargers and the Saints which is great since all of us Bay Area non-DirecTV people only get to watch the 49rs and the Raiders.  I like the bloody marys and Guinness on tap is ALWAYS a good thing.  But seriously, the food is not very good at all.  I did like the banana pancakes they had for a special one morning, but that's about it.
author: Jen F.

description:
A great, non pretentious, neighborhood juke joint bar.  Simple and great bar food... FANTASTIC local and national bands that play in a really great atmosphere.  Great ownership, great local scene in a sleepy, friendly part of town.

Simply fantastic!
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
worst service ever. 
I go in super hungry and sober. 
There is no-one to seat me at a table, so I sit at the bar. I say I'm here for food can I get a menu to the bartender and he just walks away. So the bar-maid walks up and I say I need a menu, so the old guy interrupts and yells at me "hold your horses I'll get you one in a minute". So I sit there....and sit there...and sit there....The bartender finally walks up and says "how drunk are you already?".
I scoff at him and say I'm not drunk and hadnt had a single drink in a week, and that he looks more drunk than me because he is shaking back and forth. I wasnt there for booze, just food.
So then he throws me out. On the way out I knocked over all his coasters and the silverware off the table. Then I went home and wrote this review and called them to let them know I was writing this review and they said fine. 
I also wrote one on google reviews.
She said the rude bartender doesnt work weekends our thursday or friday evenings. I may go back then....mayyyyyybe.
author: Jeff C.

description:
The only reason I'm giving this place 5 stars is because my dad works here. 

Really.
author: haley d.

description: BOB Rocks!  Connecticut Yankee is one of the best local hangouts in the city!  We go there at least once a week. The people are AWESOME!  If you go there ask for Bob,  Like I said he rocks!
author: Lance K.

description:
This place used to be great when you could bring your dog to the back outdoor patio.  But they wont let you do that anymore so there is no reason to go there...the food is average and kind of expensive for the bar food you get, the service is...bleh, the ambiance is also...bleh.  So if I cant sit outside with my dog, why come here at all? I wont be going back.

p.s. they do make good margaritas if I remember correctly...
author: Nilu r.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night with some coworkers and had a great time. The food selection was your usual burgers, salads, pastas, soups, fried bar snacks, etc twisted with some creative playful names like the Pee-Wee Herman, Quiche & Tell, and Larry Birdger. They have a full bar and a good selection of beer. We opted for the spinach salad with eggs, mushrooms, and bacon, which had a tasty different type of dressing, and the cajun gumbo, which was not bad, but I've had better. Overall, the food was just okay, nothing to rave about.

The place is a bit small and covered with sports memorabilia. It has a very chill atmosphere and you could tell it is a local bar spot. By 10pm, the placed was packed because the awesome band MONTANA SLIM started playing. They rocked the house and that violinist is truly talented and awesome! I was awed by their performance and the band gives me a reason to visit this place again!
author: Linda C.

description:
This little pub is where I was introduced to Poppy Jasper on tap. They have decent outdoor seating, but the staff can be rude and the food is overpriced and just so-so. 

A decent place to drink a pint of Poppy Jasper in the sun.
author: J F.

description:
3rd best patio on Potrerro Hill.

2nd best burger.

1st least likely to have a s***y **s band on any given night.
author: Michael F.

description:
Red Sox, Buffalo Wings, Patriots, Sierra Nevada, Prime Rib. What else do you need?

I used to live up the street from this friendly little Bostonian dive bar and truly miss is a great deal. The food [except for the buffalo wings] can approach inedible at times but the vast cold tap beer selection and big screen sports more than makes up for it.

The Yankee will always hold a special place in my heart. On February 14, 2004, my partner of 16 years and I got married at City Hall [it was that weekend when it was briefly legal]. Since Valentine's Day was a hard reservation to get [especially with all of our friends who had come to be witnesses], we couldn't find any place else to go but the Yankee. It was very spur of the moment. They were so nice to us [they found us a cake] and the people in the bar were happy and excited to share in the party. It was almost like a huge wedding except without the catering bill and nasty relatives.

Also, on those 3 days when it is nice enough to sit outside in San Francisco, they have an outdoor patio.

Food 3
Decor 1
Service 5
Other a great place for a wedding reception 5
author: Allan H.

description:
Last night we ventured into Potrero Hill after work for a drink and dinner and ended up here. 

The atmosphere was cozy with a nice beer list. I give kudos to any bar serving cider, my drink of choice, but I think I can get that just about anywhere.

The service wasn't bad, the gal waiting on us was nice enough, but the place was pretty empty.

The food wasn't great, but the average sized portions were fairly priced and certainly edible.

The one thing I cannot stand is a place that is not clean. We sat next to the window, which was covered in a thick layer of dust and not only was there a dead fly, but a dead bee as well! Ewww.

I am terribly sorry to give such poor marks, but the visible dirt really grossed me out!
author: Karen S.

description:
Nightmare.  The food is disgusting and inedible.  The staff is so ridiculously incompetent, its laughable.   

Went on an evening when the place wasn't crowded.   It took 45 minutes to even be acknowledged.  Another 2+ hours to be asked what our order what and then served.  We tried to get our bill and leave several times; the staff was rude and kept saying how insanely busy they were.  They weren't.  We were all former waiter/waitresses/etc.  Not busy.  Just pathetically bad service.   Disgusting, cheap, poorly made food.  To boot, you can't even drink your misery away b/c no one ever notices when your glass is empty and you have to chase them down for refills.  Wasted too many hours of my life in this place and will never go back.

Don't go here.  There are so many amazing places to eat/drink in this city; this place is a joke.
author: L S.

description:
I recently moved into the neighborhood and this was the closest bar to me. The bar staff was very welcoming and since I was a new face, they took the time to ask me where I was from and how I liked the city, etc.

This place is good for a evening weeknight dinner/drink or a low key weekend night as it is usually very laid back. I have never seen it too crowded and it seems to be a lot of locals.

Most of the food was only ok, but the burgers are very good. Great tap beer selection.

Don't go too far out of your way for a night out here, but if you are a local, this place is def worth a visit!
author: Kevin M.

description: Service was OK, I had the Larry Birdger, wasn't bad, but the prices are high.  Kind of run down, not worse bar I've been to
author: Spencer S.

description: Went to CY last night, now I remember why we have not been in here in over a year (and we live really close).  Sweaty bartender is an asshole.  Bathrooms are filthy and smell like a port-a-potty.  Food was expensive and not great.  Server was a super nice guy and we left him a nice tip.  Will not go back.
author: Deb S.

description: I have to go here once a month for their Cobb Salad.  I love it.  The people are friendly, the setting is "neighborhood bar".  On those nice Potrero days, sitting outside on the patio is great.  BTW - fried are also really good and my partner loves their burgers.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Not only are the sugar coated fries with garlic sauce really yummy, the Larry Birdger is, too. Their outdoor patio rocks, the heat lamps are acually working and so warm that this frostbite person had to move to the far end of the table to stay cool. In a t-shirt. In October. While other people in the US and elsewhere are already scraping off ice from their car windshields. Yes! 

But really: the Yankee is a fine place to watch all kinds of sports, too - such as soccer games and rather cultish faves such as table tennis - on DVD!  And check out their over 100 year old beer fridge with integrated taps behind the bar. Oh, and they prepare/bake the deserts on the premises - the key lime pie could've used a bit more lime, though.
author: Roland A.

description:
To a reviewer below: Crabcakes are a local delicacy in Baltimore and OJ played for the Buffalo Bills...geddit? 

I like this place. I'm a Red Sox fan, though B&R in the City (parents from CT) and I'll come here several times during the baseball season and usually once or so during the off-season, just to chow down when I'm in the hood. 

The food's a notch above the sports bar average and they stock quite a few beers. I'm alright with the prices as well. The memorabilia is great, as you can really spend 15-20 minutes looking at stuff. Back in the day this place used to stock ChinMusic, an awesome baseball and punk magazine (example: Billy Beane interviews Johnny Ramone). That it did so kind of explains a lot about the place: rock and baseball come together. It should be noted for the record that this place has been around a while - 20 years or so - and was doing the Red Sox thing long before it became trendy. 

The service is definitely inconsistent, but over the years (I've been coming here for about 8 or 9 years now) I've figured out a few things. 

1) The staff are usually locals and are not Red Sox fans. That doesn't mean they hate the Red Sox, but you gotta take that in mind. 

2) The staff seem to be largely artist types, people paying the bills while they play in a band and kids paying their way through college, so they don't really want to be here. That doesn't mean they're going to be a huge dick to you, but you need to remember they aren't your servants.

3) This place gets a pretty diverse crowd..so again, not everybody is going to be a Red Sox fan.

4) A lot of times Red Sox fans come in, drink water, and don't tip. Seriously. So you might be getting grouped in with the bad apples, but be cool, polite, and show em you're not going to sit there and stiff them and they get much nicer.

Basically, if you come into this joint with a laid back, indie rock and tatty baseball (preferably Sox, Giants or A's) cap viewpoint on life, you'll like this place and you'll probably get along with the waitstaff and everyone else. In my experience the problems are often caused by aggro frat boy Murph and Sully types who are pissed no one else is chanting Yankees suck, drink too many (or none at all) Sam Adams and don't tip.
author: Flynn H.

description:
I can't believe that I haven't eaten at a place that's a stumbling block and a half from where I live.  I've been to parties here (and I thought the food was good), and I've come to hear music here (Pink!!!  Woo hoo!), so it's for that reason that I review it.  It's a great neighborhood spot with real music in a perfect venue (okay, it can get a little crowded, but that's good).   

It's also fun for an old-school drink with a totally different crowd at an earlier hour.
author: Laurel B.

description:
I've been here a couple times for beers, the selection is fine.
They've had some Onion happy hours here too, so there's at least one more vote for it.
I wish the patio was larger, but I'm not gonna be too picky since its nice to hang out there regardless.
author: Tom S.

description:
I tend to strongly dislike Boston sports fans, their arrogant pride, and their teams' current athletic superiority to once-great Bay Area franchises that are run by utter morons (just kidding John York, the 49ers are in great shape, wink).

So naturally I ended up here for the Super Bowl this year to watch the undefeated Patriots take on Weeli Manning and the "New York Football Giants." Since this place is right in my neighborhood, I had been here a few times before, and really liked their beer selection and food, but I couldn't stand being surrounded by Red Sox paraphernalia. Well, I considered the outcome of this Super Bowl as some weird type of revenge I guess.

If you ever want to see a place clear out fast, just pack it full of New Englanders, get them drunk, and then show Tom Brady's defeat on 6 different screens.

But seriously, all in all this is a great neighborhood bar to grab drinks at with friends and show a little West-coast pride to remind them where they are.
author: Chris P.

description:
Quite possible my new favorite slightly divey bar.

The first time I came in was election night and the place was packed.  Luckily my friends and I got there early.  We had a great spot at the bar and the bartender was always checking our drinks even though the crowd was swelling.  Our food was definitely better than your average bar food.  They had a great selection of the typical burgers, and then good soups and salads.

Ample space, tables outside.  Plenty of TV's, one for any angle you are viewing from.  Finally a great NE vibe, with lots of fun quirky chachkeys and sports memorabilia.
author: Becky A.

description:
Went here to catch da Sox Yankees game.  Their veggie burger wasn't that bad and they had pear cider, which I've had better.

Only comment is that they need to turn on the volume on the TV when the game is on, think they played the same CD three times in a row during the game.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Will need to go back to watch a Patriots game at this Bostonians home away from home...

Great pub grup and beer list- services was a little lacking but what do you expect from a crowded bar?   Has that real east coast/chicago bar feel to it- those transplants out here will understand it as soon as they walk into this place.  It's not just another pretend sports bar with a bunch of TV's- this is where real people and fans go.   Just like the places you went to back home...
author: sean b.

description:
