I was in the area for a show at Bottom of the Hill a couple days ago with some friends and we wandered into this place to get food before the show.

The atmosphere was great and even the menu was clever and fun to read through - part of the proceeds of the O.J.'s hot wings go to help him find the real killers (or so the menu says...). The draft been selection was good and one girl with our group said her bloody mary was excellent (I'm not a fan of bloody mary's however, so she'll have to be my authority on that one). And once we got our food it was quite good (although the "Carolina" barbecue sandwich was a mustard based sauce which is not traditional barbecue - well, maybe in South Carolina, but I'm an NC boy which is clearly the authority on good barbecue - but the sandwich was good regardless, so I'll let it slide).

The unfortunate part about this place was the service, but I don't really think they care. There was an air of pretentiousness to the staff, it seemed as though only local regulars were welcome. To be fair, there were other people that joined our group late and pulled chairs from another table into their pathway to other tables, which can be frustrating, I'm sure, but we were not an obnoxious group and the latecomers apologized for taking the chairs and they sat at a separate table.  It also took a long time for our food to be ready and our order was in, before our other group arrived.

With that being said, I'd go again (preferably with a smaller group) because the food and the ambiance were great and the prices were reasonable for the amount/quality of food. Hopefully the service will be better next time.
author: Chris H.

description: I live three blocks away from this place, have had many delightful times here, and love their Nicoise Salad. But the reason I am writing this review today? I left my phone on the table when I left after lunch, deep in conversation with a friend, and was almost all the way home before the waiter who was trying to return it finally caught up with me.  Seriously. How nice is that?
author: Shannon K.

description:
Convenient to Bottom of the Hill pre-show food/drinks. Huge patio in the back, which is great when the weather is nice. I can't remember exactly what I ate so I'd have to say that the menu and subsequent dinner was not a memorable affair. 

If you happen to sit inside, there's a little stage with local musicians. It's cute.
author: Angela N.

description:
I just returned from a work lunch at Connecticut Yankee, and as much as I'd like to give it four stars for the friendly (albeit slow) service, the decent food, and the entertaining atmosphere, I have to dock a point for the lack of vegetarian options. Sure, there is a salad or a burger, but being in San Francisco I'm used to more veggie variety.

That being said, this is a fun sports-y bar located somewhat-conveniently in Patrero Hill. We were able to walk from the UCSF Mission bay campus in less than five minutes. Entering Connecticut Yankee, you may be a bit overwhelmed by the sports paraphernalia, a few "yankee" style decorations, and some more random pieces like a hanging bicycle. Once you get seated (in front of one of the four televisions airing some kind of sports game, if you're lucky), you will not be bored by the eclectic patronage, no matter how boring your own company may be.

The menu provides a few soup and salad options (the large salads are very large!), as well as some particularly meaty sandwiches (think meatballs, reuben, etc), and a few random selections such as pasta and quiche. Be sure to check the white boards on the wall for daily specials, today was a salmon sandwich and seafood fettucine. 

As far as prices, it is somewhat overpriced for a sports bar (salads $6-8, sandwiches/entrees $8-12), and the serving sizes are decent, but not grandiose. I went with the vegetarian burger and fries, and was satisfied but I won't be writing home (or does yelp count?).

In conclusion, I wouldn't seek the Connecticut Yankee out, but I wouldn't avoid it either.
author: Erin M.

description:
Cool place.

Good amount of TV's to watch different games (including the Houston game I watched tonite)...

The food is great.  Every item has some kinda athlete attached to it (get the OJ Buffalo Wings, apparently part of the money goes to finding the real killers).  The wings were great as was the meatball sandwich (The Mike Stivic).

I really do like this place.  I'll be back soon enough...=)
author: Mike V.

description:
I went here for the first time on Sunday. Which is funny, because I work a few blocks away, but I've never gone during or after work. Well, it's not funny, exactly. But my coworkers often go here for burgers at lunch, but I never partake. I'm a bringing my lunch from home kind of girl. But this weekend I was in the neighborhood, and I decided to check it out.

I'm from Massachusetts, and I love the Red Sox. Not in that 'I'm the Number One super fan evah!!!!!" kind of way. Just, well, I'm from Massachusetts. I went to Fenway with my family all the time. So I felt at pretty much at home here.

I ordered a hamburger with a salad subbed for fries. I'm on a diet (ugh), otherwise I would have ordered a cheese burger, with fries. But cheeseless burger without fries was pretty tasty. And the salad was pretty generously sized. My boyfriend ordered a pulled pork sandwich, which he enjoyed.

The menu is pretty limited. So if you are looking for more than pub basics, this might not the place for you. But if you are looking for a solid burger to enjoy while watching a game on tv, this might be the place for you.
author: Kristen H.

description:
I've live in the neighborhood and I keep trying to find a reason to eat here and like this place. In the 15 years that I've lived here, I still can't 
find a reason to like this place. THE SERVICE SUCKS MORE THAN A
BABY SUCKLING PIG! THE FOOD IS EXPENSIVE  AND I ALWAYS END UP LEAVING HALF ON MY PLATE. I ordered a steak sandwich and half of that ended up in my napkin because it was something gross that I couldn't chew. NASTY! My dining companion ordered a salad
that was swimming in salad dressing and she ate about 1/4 of it and we
left. The two stars are for some of the best fries in the area. I suppose I could just stop in for fries and a drink and be happy with that. I have to remind myself not to order those overpriced items that are not to be confused with consumable food.
author: Cindy J.

description:
Go for brunch outdoors!

Never been for dinner, but it's one of my regular weekend  brunch spots.  Food is good, but sitting outside on the patio on a sunny Potrero Hill day is the reason I keep going back.
author: Richard Y.

description:
I had low expectations for the CY... only because we drove to the city for an As Tall As Lions set at Bottom of the Hill and when we got out of the car ... I was already kind of bummed that my idea to get up there early and find a place to 'grab a bite' seemed to be defeated since autobody shops and textile manufacturers aren't usually in the business of serving up some food and drinks.

We decided to just start walking and figure it out from there... we started getting close to the CY and I swear to god I thought it was a used book shop.  It doesn't really look like that at all, so.... I can't really explain why I thought it was one... but the good news is... that it was a bar! A bar that served food!

Here's what happened.  We went in, the bartender pointed out where we could sit.  Someone brought us menus, we ordered drinks... it was glorious!  The menu is not only funny-- but actually has really good, non-pub food on it.  We just got a blackened chicken strip appetizer, and it was actually realllllllly good! Everything else that was being served around us, looked really good, too!

They have a full service bar (vodka tonic was $4.50-- cheeeeeeap!), had about 3 televised games on, was bustling with people, and seems to be a diamond in the rough!

:o)
author: Christina P.

description:
The pros about this place:
It gives off some kind of homely vibe (like some of those in movies). It seems as if they get a bunch of regulars in here and everyone's very casual, loud and cool. 
We told the person who ultimately took our order that we were in a hurry. He explained to us that it would be iffy for us to receive and eat our food, but that he'd try his best. And so the food did come out pretty quick.

The cons about this place:
We were not freakin acknowledge for the longest time after walking in. The guy just stood around, walked away, stood around, walked away and then came back. But that was after we stood and starred and stood and starred. 
There was probably some kind of confusion when I ordered my steak. I had the garlic steak and asked for it medium-rare, then medium. My friend was suggesting medium-rare, so I don't know what he ultimately put down. But my steak came out to be more like medium well to medium. And there was a bunch of fat on the side, which I hate, hate, hate.
The clam chowder sucked ass. It was too milky, but not creamy. It had almost no taste, besides from a milky one. No good.
The bathroom is old and small and eww.

In-between:
The fries were really fried, but my friend liked it. I'm more of a meaty fries girl, and this place didn't quite deliver. 
The bread for my steak sandwich was pretty good actually. 
The sour dough bread wasn't bad either.
The gumbo was alright. The shrimp in it was good, but the overall portion was way too small for being $15.
There was another order the BIRDGER (something like that) and it was said to be alright.

This place is a bar, so do expect it to be loud. Do expect a tv with baseball or other sports on. Do expect the place to be old school and everything to be somewhat worn out. There is an outdoor area to sit and eat and drink as well as the indoor area.
author: Elaine H.

description:
Came here on Sunday to get my Sox/Pats on (god I love it when the games are back to back).

It turns out they only have two satellite feeds at once, so when the sox game was supposed to be on, there were originally two football games on and--in a RED SOX BAR--no sox game.

Luckily, the game was on TBS so they could get it anyway, but still.  

So the bar was pretty empty while we (the 6 sunday footballers) watched the end of the sox game, but by about 15 minutes before the pats game started, the place was PACKED and the two servers were totally overwhelmed.  Not their fault that it was understaffed, and they stayed pretty cheerful despite it, but service was slow as Matt Cassel's rise to prominence.

I have to say, the food was delicious--my tuna melt/clam chowdah combo was great, and it's hard to find good chowdah in this city.  (THERE SHOULD BE CLAMS IN IT, BOUDIN!!)  The garlic chicken nuggets were fantastic, as was the horseradishy-mustard dipping sauce for them.  Breakfast looked phenominal, good nachos, crispy thin onion rings... yeah it was good.

I have to do negative two stars for the service and lack of satellite feeds, unfortunately, 'cause I really liked this place otherwise, but then, I'm a teensy bit biased.  

oh and uh... GO SOX AND PATS!
author: Caitlin M.

description:
When I lived in the Mission we'd always come over here for Sunday brunch or dinner during the week when we just couldn't think of anything else.  Always love the atmosphere and the crowd is cool.  Service ranges widely, as does the food.  One night the food will be great and you'll get it brought to your table quickly.  Another time, perhaps on a Sunday, you'll wait over an hour for your french toast - unacceptable.  Not sure why I keep going there - I guess because it's easy and I'm lazy.  

Fritz, the owner, is a fun guy.  Also enjoy the great patio and easy parking.
author: .Hon H.

description:
Seemed like a fun sports bar....
But don't let the menu mislead you. You don't get a T-shirt when you order the Vegi-burger, its just 9$ worth of soy and bread + some green stuff, and a light order of fries. 
The waitress was a little out of it also, it was late on a Saturday night, and it seemed like it was her first night there, So I'll be nice...this time.
I want to give you only 2 stars C.Y., but it was my first time visiting, so I'll give you the benefit of the doubt....this time.
author: Dr. L.

description:
Great Food, hardy, good beers. Fun bands.

Can't beat the Sunday morning steak and eggs!
author: Scott K.

description:
I was there the night Jay Q. talks about and it would seem like the staff was behaving poorly except for The folks that wanted to move tables and change channels to put the game(s) on just took it upon themselves to start rearranging things. I watched the whole thing happen a bit in shock at the display. I think the whole thing would have been blown off by the staff but those in the room started in by saying how much the bar sucked and that they were going to find a new bar. It would have been ameliorated still but the "Red Sox Nation" people were being obnoxious. I was looking forward to hanging out with the meetup group but it was pretty rough. I drunkenly called them entitled ninnys with my review of the group. 

Turns out if you treat the staff with some respect and courtesy they are more than willing to help you. After the "red sox" fans left I sat at the bar and the server that was "slow" and "rude" bought me a whiskey, the barman called me a cab and wrote on a napkin all the good spots near 16th and mission. As they closed the bar they invited me to another bar and were way nicer to me than the people I went there with. I had a great night and it was thanks to them. Thank you.
author: Matt P.

description:
Awesome heated outdoor patio. Cool history. Entertaining names for menu items, which are actually pretty good. Live music. A host of local mags right as you walk in the door. 

You might have to chase down your waiter, though. Used to be a chick who worked there and was timely...now it seems to be all dudes, and they're all pretty lazy. One dude has a thing for dropping off your check before you're done...it's kinda weird. But then, so is he.
author: Elle N M.

description:
Good beer drinking place. Fun and unpretentious. Quite good food...black bean soup with bread and butter, and a half-pint of Poppy Something Lager. Add the 5 guys who came in wearing COVERALLS! and you've got the perfect lunch.

It is totally east cost...the name is Connecticut YANKEE, get it? Check out the history page of their website or their menus. 

OH and UNPRETENTIOUS...they're nice there...go there, have a good time! Drink beer and eat hearty food. Watch for guys in coveralls.
author: Goodbye K.

description:
I went in on a weekday afternoon. The grumpy old bartender was grumpy but funny he just likes who he likes and you know if it ain't you! me I had no problem with him. He was cool.

The vegetarian chili was actually really good, patrons seem to be pretty cool too!
author: Jason K.

description: Didn't know it was a red sox spot. As an A's fan I couldn't stand it. We play softball right down the street so it's convenient and the food is decent.
author: Craig I.

description: If your a Boston Patriots fan, this bar restaurant is for you! It had pretty decent food, I got a grilled cheese and fries! The grilled cheese defiently had the little squares of cheese, so it was as fluid of a grilled cheese ( much to layered)! However my fries were awesome, really crispy yet not burnt. I got some wine as well, it was nothing special but better then beer for me! A little farther to go in potrereo hill but it was well worth it as it was crazy crowded and has a good atmosphere! It was raining when I was here, so I was unable to expierence the back patio!
author: Noelle L.

description:
I went here for lunch on my Birthday and got food poisoning. 

Seriously the only thing I ate all day until the puking stopped was a Larry Birdger and Fries. Maybe the meat was bad maybe they need to change the fry oil, I dont know.  But that shit ruined my day.

Also:

I've been for lunch probably 15 times in 2 years(I go with coworkers not my choice). Its pretty much like eating in a bar. 
The Bartender is always old and always crabby so are the waitresses. 
The food is "bar quality" at best.
Furthermore I have never understood the appeal of sports bars from different cities, why would anyone open a Boston themed sports bar in SF? you wanna do Boston, go to Boston. And why is it the Connecticut Yankee? In all honesty I dont care, this dark dismal hole ruined my Birthday, and in all the times Ive been there I have never once been impressed by any of it. The Barman's a jerk, the waitresses are short with you. Fuck this place. If I want an outdoor patio with live music I can go right down the street to Thee Parkside, which also serves food (which by the way is way better and more creative Banh Mi Sandwiches, Cubans, Great Burgers, Tater Tots Vegan Chili etc...) and I dont have to be enveloped by shitty sports memoribilia from teams I dont give a shit about. The Drinks are also way overpriced $5 for an Anchor Steam the Factory is 3 blocks away. At Thee Parkside (again right down the street) Beers are between $2 and $4 the way it should be, with great daily specials. $12 Buckets, $6 Pitchers etc...

Hey Connecticut Yankee FUCK YOU!
author: Ryan P.

description:
1) Irving Fryar chicken fingers are an excellent twist - as they are not deep fried and covered in cajun sauce.  Declicious

2) Some of the best nachos in the city - perfectly crispy

3) Awesome staff and beer selection

4) Great live music and a place to watch the sports (especially Boston sports)

5) Sit outside in the sun!
author: Jon S.

description:
Seems like most of the patrons are either here to watch a game, (side note: if it's the Red Sox vs the Angels, who is everybody cheering for?  And if I just outed myself as baseball-ignorant, well, fair enough), or, like me, they're here because Bottom of the Hill is running late on the whole door-opening thing.  There's food, which I would have been inclined to try, but with the game on this place was wall-to-wall packed, so we settled for some beers and milling around in the little beer garden.  As sports bars go, it's got a nice, warm, wood-heavy decor, but not too remarkable otherwise.

Bonus point for the awesome beer taps they have built into the cabinet behind the bar.  Bonus point rescinded for the fact that they were out of *all* of my top 3 beer choices.
author: Wes M.

description:
Have been here lots of times during lunch. The food is okay here. I really like the sports bar scene. I had the Club Sandwich I thought it was good except for the part when I was choking on the broken toothpick. 
Other than that we had a great time. Great place for a group lunch. The outdoor seating would have been perfect that day too.

Will come again but I won't order anything with a toothpick in it. LOL
author: Norma Denisse S.

description:
I dig The Yankee. It's obvious that it's a neighborhood joint and quite popular with the local residents which is ALWAYS a good sign. I particularly like the outdoor back patio! As far as bar food is concerned, The Yankee offers a great menu selection of the usuals with fun and creative names.

You can also catch live music here from time to time, but I much prefer this place as a restaurant/bar to hang with friends, have a beer and nurse a common hang over.
author: alexa c.

description:
This is a tough one for me.

I eat here more than anywhere else so for that I feel they deserve a good number of stars from me. The food isn't spectacular but its good and consistent. The prices are nothing to write home about but also not over the top. Its basically just...a standard good place to go. 

The menu is varied so its a good place to go with a crowd that is craving different things (and they can accommodate large groups). I love having the outside space on a nice day but seeing that dogs aren't allowed on another review and having just adopted a puppy - thats a big negative. 

We'll leave it at that for now...
author: Inna H.

description:
WHAT THE HELL????

I grew up on the Hill and cant stand to see whats going on around there.

went in to the Yankee a couple months ago for lunch...shitty service and food (where have you gone Nick)

OK so went back for drinks a couple weeks later... not a busy night but the bartender decided he would rather serve a couple of "locals" who were cheesing out of there minds (if you don't know what i men then ask someone) from somewhere like Kansas Oklahoma or Ohio or some Shit. 
Didn't trip too much on bein dissed, but when he pulled the Local thing out I was Like FUCK YOU. Maybe the bartender was impressed by the frequent trips to the bathroom by the "locals" to give a shit about natives trying to have a drink and watch a hockey game (oh yeah New England Sports Bar my Ass) 

Go to Blooms and get Thai BBQ next door instead of wasting your time here
author: Scotty B.

description:
Fun place, cool atmosphere, great food. 

I had a Tuna melt sandwich with a black bean soup side and scarfed it down, it was delicious. I really liked the outside patio area with big communal tables, it gives the place a really cool atmosphere.
author: Jake K.

description:
I was *so* hungry.  And look at this, the Lasagne Harding for $14.25.  For that money, it must be huge!  Well, it wasn't.  It was decent lasagne, but get serious.

The vibe is definitely East Coast.  I might come back here to watch sports, or to learn why people make those jokes about Connecticut, but not to eat.  I'm saving up for my college education.

Best thing about this bar: little kids running around yelling "fish sticks!"
author: Ben K.

description:
I can't get enough of the Connecticut Yankee. Anyone who knows me well these days knows that there is nothing more satisfying to me than a pint of Sam Adams, Buffalo wings and the Red Sox--this place does it all and does it oh so well. This is the buffalo wing joint that all others get matched up to (except maybe John Harvard's in Harvard Square). The wings here have great tang and their blue cheese is superb! My guy is a huge Pats fan (as am I) so for us it is always either baseball or football season just as it should be ;o)

They have a great menu full of grub burgers with great names like the Larry Birdger and the Wade Boggs, its every New Englander's dream. Although a true California girl I did willingly move to Boston for an extended period of time so it makes me just as much a New Englander as anyone else, even if mostly at heart. If you are ever looking for a place to watch New England sports with fellow New Englanders then this is your spot.

The only reason it didn't get a full 5 stars is because the place has the word Yankee in the name for Pete's sake and their website is www.theyankee.com... GO SOX!!!
author: Sugey G.

description: Had good beer - Anchor Liberty, and good food - clam chowder and nachos. Great atmosphere in this building that dates from 1907. I'm not a fan of Boston sports teams, and this place is wall-to-wall Boston sports memorobilia - but still a great place to hang out and eat before heading to one of the nearby clubs such as Bottom of the Hill or Thee Parkside.
author: Craig Y.

description:
Connecticut is definitively OK. The calamari's just about the okayest calamari I've ever had, as are their burgers and mixed drinks. And the menu humor.

Still, when you want a glass o' beer and a plate of quick-fried frozen squid, and you're in the neighborhood, and if the back patio isn't packed, then it's a nice place to find yourself.
author: jason l.

description: I liked this place. Nice vibe and crowd. Interesting non-California feeling menu, which I liked. The food I had was all respectable, including the chicken fingers and the veggie chili. Pretty reasonably priced too. I would go back.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Turkey burgers are hard to screw up yet it's pretty hard to find a good one. They have a great one called the "Larry Birdger" a delicious big patty with grilled onions and your choice of cheese! My friend had the "Fowl Play" a breaded chicken breast that came with yummy garlic mash and green beans. We ate off each others plates and boy was it tasty. 

The entire staff is awesome and super friendly. It was fairly packed with patrons eating and drinking while watching the game on one of the many TV's. I love the history behind this place and it really does have that New England feel. I suspect natives would enjoy it as much as I did.
author: Erin D.

description:
They have really strong drinks.

Seriously, my drinks got progressively stronger as the night went on. I'm glad I wasn't driving or anything.

They have lots of tables, plenty of stools at the bar, and tvs. Never saw a wait for the restroom (1 for each).
author: Christina C.

description:
Good beer on tap at a fair price.  The onion rings weren't worth ordering, stay away from them.  

GO A'S!!!!!!! F--- the Soxs.
author: Keith J.

description:
Pros:
The Yankee is fun for small cozy music shows where there isn't a large crowd dancing.

The food is decent and on Sat/Sun mornings there is some yummy breakfast served! Dinner is good as well and the bartenders are very friendly and quick to serve you!!

I have yet to pay a cover charge to see a show because they usually don't have anyone working the door.

Younger music lovers (I've even seen a child) tend to get in.

Cons:
Large shows get VERY crowded, the dance area is small and the tables make it even smaller.

Only one bathroom which is sometimes a problem but it is clean at least!
author: Amber E.

description: Classic casual American food -- I've been here both for lunch with a group and in the evening. It was recommended to me by a long-time resident of this 'hood. Extra star for being an unpretentious establishment -- hipsters beware. Dependable place to come to when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Bodhi D.

description: Beers and outdoors, that's about it. Small, no pitchers, and lousy fries.
author: Jack K.

description:
[from 4 to 2 stars]

I don't care one way or the other about Boston.  I don't, sorry.

I do care about pubs that serve food... good food... EDIT: this place has bitten the dust in terms of food.

I went last night to get a pint or two and a deliscious burger.  The burger was borderline uneadible.  Lame. The fries were those crappy ones that have some wierd 'flavor coating' on them.

Don't worry the beer is still cold.

Still, On a non-game night I will here before going to Bottom of the Hill. Chances are that I will go to goat hill pizza instead.
author: Thadd L.

description:
I've been going to the Yankee for many, many years and consider it my solid, decent post-event go-to choice.  The patio is always my fave, barring sub-freezing temperatures or rain.

The food will not blow you away, but... hello?  It's saloon food and I've never been disappointed holding it to that standard.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Burger is tasty. The Yankee fries are also delightfully lightly crunchy.

The meatball sub and cole slaw were rather meh. Also, for a sports bar, their TVs are paltrily small, although they make up for that by having a little stage with live music.

Also, for a place named "Connecticut Yankee", they had a poseurly-dearth of Connecticut/Yankee-related sports paraphenalia. The most obvious piece they have is a T.O. Eagles jersey (at least a Niners jersey would have been local), followed by some random hockey jersey.
author: Rob T.

description:
After a softball game at Jackson Field, the guys and I like to roll over for a couple of post-game beers and food.  If it's nice outside, grab a bench table out back and enjoy the weather.

Try the "OJ Killer Wings", a tasty dish dedicated to Potrero's own.  (History break: OJ grew up around Potrero Hill and the residents hate him because he never gave back to the community, not because of a little incident with Nicole and Ron. There used to be a mural across the street and OJ was in it, complete with football uniform and the addition of a bloody knife.) 

I would've given this place 4 stars, but took one away because it's a Boston bar.
author: Dave L.

description:
Best place to host a raging birthday party on the hill!

My friend Dave and I hosted our birthday party here just before Christmas.  These guys were really easy to work with, let us bring our band, show ski movies on the tv's, and they helped us keep the party mood going.  All of our friends were delighted with the prices of food and drinks so everyone was fully satisfied.  And it was stumbling distance from home!
author: Amy L.

description:
For some reason, this place reminds me of Chicago.  The neighborhood I grew up in Chicago was a die hard sports neighborhood.  Every bar was full of Bears, Cubs, and Bulls fans.  If a game was on, guaranteed that  of the bar would be watching the game and the other  wouldn't be because they are too drunk, trying to pick someone up, or from out of town.  

When we walked in, I felt at home... even though the bar definitely didn't represent Chicago.  It was more the atmosphere.  Good hip hop was blasting, a different game on every screen, a diverse crowd, lots of delicious beers on tap, and a great bar menu.  I had a delicious poppy jasper amber ale and my friend had the full sail brewmaster's special Belgium blonde (or something like that).  The food was pretty good for bar food.  I had veggie chili that was loaded with beans, tomatoes, and jicama.  It was a huge helping that I couldn't finish.  My friend had the buffalo wings and he was very pleased.

We left happy.  Another great bar in my neighborhood.  I'll come back to watch some Chicago games.
author: Zoe H.

description:
Based on the other reviews of this place, I should probably preface mine with a few notes:

1) I didn't eat the food.
2) My first (and only, thus far) visit to the Connecticut Yankee was to see one of my old friends play as show.
3) It was a bizarre night in San Francisco, with late-evening temperatures in the high 70s/low 80s and a clear sky.

All of that taken into consideration, perhaps the stars were aligned.. but I did enjoy my night. The back patio is great and definitely deserves a glowing mention (although if they don't have heat lamps as some reviewers have suggestion, I could see that being a disappointment) and the bar is decent-sized. It was a little squishy inside, especially for a popular show, but the staff seemed accommodating enough. I'd be interested to try the food, just to see what this place is like on a normal night, but based on first (and, granted, unique) impressions alone, I'd be willing to give this place a second try.
author: Philly B.

description: The Connecticut Yankee is a pretty sweet bar. It's 'neighborhoody.' It's also close enough to bike to for a variation on lunch. (I work by AT&T park.) There's beer and whatnot.
author: Klevin D.

description:
ok, so i am an all or nothing kind of gal, i guess.  i either give all the stars i can or one, it seems.  But i loved this joint because i like hearty meals and good beer / liquor and they have both... or is that all three?  anyway, i liked it.  a lot.  i thot i discovered the place and took m'love there.  He let me know that he had been there many times.  I felt small.   but if i can help ONE person find this lovely little pub, my job is done.  Go there.

Love,
Sara
author: Sara W.

description:
A great bah for a couple of beeahs.  Between the wait staff who barely give you a second glance and the mysteriously sticky floor, I feel like I'm right back in one of my favorite Boston pubs.  

The food is...well, food.  Edible? Certainly.  Gary Danko? I think not.  It's dark and unpretentious - the kind of place where you'd feel uncomfortable in a suit, unless you're also wearing a Sox hat.

Bottom line: If you've ever had an argument about whether or not you can save a parking space with a lawn chair and understand that for all intents and purposes I95 and Rt.128 are the same road, then stop in during a Pats or Sox game for a tiny taste of New England.
author: Sara J.

description: A great time, especially if you are looking for a low-key spot to go to after the Anchor Steam Brewery tour.  Decent food and beer selection, but what really matters is the hilarious trivia and banter with the bartender.  I apologize that I can't recall his name, but he is from Ithaca, and knows his geography trivia!
author: Nette C.

description: Purported Red Sox bar. I went a few times a couple years ago and, ok, sure it's wall-papered with Boston memorabilia but do you know what happened to me when I was watching a Red Sox game there some few Augusts ago? Besides the fact that I was shunted into the backroom (whatever) because most of their troglodytic patrons were football fans. What happened was that a waitress came up to our table and asked that I not cheer so loudly, that I "keep it down," to use her parlance. And why did I have to keep it down while cheering for the Red Sox in what purports to be a Red Sox bar? Because a Yankees fan asked her to. I'm not making this up. Fuck this place.
author: T U.

description: I'll give the place another star because Steve the bartender from Rutgers knows his sports history and is a funny old guy to keep you entertained and distracted from the fact that your food is still MIA.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
I absolutely love the friendly neighborhood vibe of this place...it's not a palace but then that ain't what I like when I'm searching for beer and bar food. The food here is damn good and the staff are swell as well. The outdoor seating puts it over the top for me and earns my 5 stars.


They also do a great job hosting the annual San Francisco Bluegrass and Old-Time festival kick of party.
author: Tom W.

description:
chicken wings and chili = a little slice of heaven.

I'm deducting a star for the sheer fact that i'm a yankees fan and the place is covered in red sox gear.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Music, Baseball, Beer... Is there much more to life? If so, I don't care anyways. I am the luckiest girl in the world because I live 6 blocks from the Yank, and I can bring my son to a "bar" and drink the yummiest micro-brews on tap while he eats grilled cheeses'. Not to mention the baseball cards the sweetest bartender gives him almost every time we go.
 I have met the coolest SF parents at this place, and everyone is so laid back and friendly. Did I mention the combo of beer & children... but no "bar losers" to spoil your mood. We must go here twice a month.
I MUST mention the "Ty Cobb" salad. How many of you can say you've had homemaid ranch dressing? I am a salad officionado of sorts, and in my 31 years this has to be one of my favorites. It is flawlessly executed. Just like the bluegrass music, baseball on tv, and salad in your mouth combination..... I love you Connecticut Yankee.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Summary: Crappy Service, Poor Food, and I now officially hate the Boston Red Sox.

Walked there on a relatively early Friday night to have a causal dinner and drinks......Walked in to the dimly lit bar at about 6-7PMish. Their was plenty of seating and they had 4 TV's all playing the Giants/Diamondbacks Game. Had the Philly Steak sandwich called the "Dr. J" and my girlfriend had the nachos.......it took a really really long time to get served, and our waitress didn't even come by our table to see if everything was OK after the food was served. 

Throw in a bunch of "Mass-hole" obnoxious Boston Red Sox Fans and I would rather not return, but sadly I will because its the only sports bar relatively close to my place
author: Tom D.

description:
Dear Jesus,
Maybe I was having a hefty day but... everything I sat on felt like it was going to topple over under me! 


Beware of the dangling bar step it's a little broken, and the bar stole with the tape on it it's a little broken, oh and the women's toilet seat it's a little broken as well... regardless I'm a sucker for all things that are old (keep your pants on geezers). So all the semi broken stuff just added more charm to the place. We wandered into this bar before a show at Bottom of the Hill. This is a very welcoming place, you can almost feel the history as soon as you walk in. (You can read a brief summery on it on the back of the menu.) All the pictures on the wall are a bit overwhelming but hey it gives you something to look at. Our bar tender was very nice and even cracked a couple of jokes for a laugh. They have a vast selection of beers on tap which is always a plus. We had an order of fries they were simply delicious. I would return just to have some more of the fries.  Not that I'm a mustard eater but my friend is and he was pleasantly surprised to have had gray poupon as an option. I bet this place probably gets wild on Sundays, with all the sports fans. I'll probably have to return for a beer and some game watching.
author: Carolina P.

description:
I really want to give this place five stars, I really do.  I just can't.

This places gets five stars as hands down the best place to watch a Boston Sports game... period.  Well, outside Boston that is.  The problem with the Connecticut Yankee though is that it totally loses it whenever people actually go there in large groups.  It seems like their waitstaff just folds which is obviously not fitting for a Boston sports bar.

Case in point, the AFC championships 2007.  This place was packed and it seemed like it would be a good place to watch the game.  Come halftime my friends and I decide to go outside and grab a table thinking that there would be a great place to discuss the game and get something  to eat.  I informed a waiter that we we're heading outside, and he said he'd be outside in a few.  We cut him some slack since we knew the place was a madhouse that night.

30-40 minutes pass by and multiple waiters walk past us.  One of them was actually visibly ignoring another table when they were asking him for ketchup or something.  After that we decided to head up the hill to some other place that would actually wait on us. So I went back inside and the original waiter we talked to was just standing there doing nothing, I told him not to bother since we were heading somewhere else.  As we were leaving, I noticed he was taking some time to text message someone.  Jessh... they just gave up at halftime... kind of like the Patriots that day.

They lost the other star during a Red Sox/Yankees game when the waitress only came back once during a nine inning game.

The food is pretty good though.  They have a garlic mayo on the veggie burger which sometimes makes up for the crappy service.

Oh, the other thing is that they have a bunch of Hi-Def TVs but don't pony up to pay for the actual HD service....

Oh Yankee...
author: Alex D.

description:
great food (for a bar)!  they exceed expectations.  of course, it's just sandwiches and stuff like that, but i had a good time here.  I can't give it 5 stars, b/c its just sandwiches, but you know... it's a good lunch place if you're in the hill.  the waitstaff is great, the fat tire was really flat though (old keg maybe?) but we told the waitress about it, she replaced our beers with new selections.

good prices, nice place. cheap to moderate, depending on choice and apps
author: Bruce W.

description: I was lucky enough to be introduced to this quaint nook of a restaurant this afternoon by my fabulous husband. And I love it!!!! I had the chicken sandwich with basil, which was delish and the perfect portion. My hubbie had the pulled pork which was "tasty". Good sign. But the highlight has got to be the French fries. Omg! They are soooooo good! Like the crunchy coating of fish and chips, but not oily at all. Again, the husband says they are "tasty". Too bad I don't live in SF - or maybe not. My waistline doesn't need food this good every day! :-)
author: Katie M.

description:
Every now and again I fool myself into coming to this place when I am tired of all the other food options on the hill.  If I didn't live less than a block away, I would never come here. Hopefully I never will again.

Service=slow, inattentive, terrible
food=mediocre
hippie jam bands=need I say more?
author: Excitable R.

description:
I come here when I'm really hungry and I want something that I know I will like. It's always a hit for me. CHEESETEAK with mushrooms is my favorite. But, if you want something on the lighter side...yea, I'm going to say a salad. But it's so damn good. Asian chicken salad. That's the one. I haven't really tried anything else except the cold beer or cider to wash it all down. 
I sit at the bar. One of the bartenders loves table tennis...don't ever say "ping-pong" around him. Also ask for the yummy garlic dip with bread...Fuck , it's some good shit
author: Ashley J.

description: Tried the buffalo wings - they were delicious!!  The onion rings are not the big, thick kind - they're kind of stringy - but they're delicious too.
author: B. Y.

description:
So, I love this place, and sometimes I wonder why I eat there.  Have seen great shows, had amazingly fun, hippie bar nights.  Sorry to the anti-jambanders out there, but thats my scene.

However, I went there the other day for pre-NYE lunch, and the service was up and pretty down.  At times our waitress was on it, others it took 3 'asks' for my beer.  To the point I walked to the bar to get it.  Staff was certainly into their conversations. Staff being acid damaged is probably a close theory.  HOWEVER, I have never gone there for service, and won't impead me from returning.

Never seen "50%" of the beers out...  hmmm

Food can be pretty damn tasty. Burgers w/ grilled onions are delectable, and can make any starving party goer sluggish for an hour or two. Fritz is the man, and I love his establishment.
author: Kevin Q.

description:
A great place to hang out and have a drink on Potrero Hill. I had a decent size Stoli dirty martini there tonight for $6.50. My partner had a nice hefeweizen for 4 bucks. In the past the food has been good, much better than your average bar food. A few months ago I had a seafood pasta that was excellent - a fresh marinara sauce that had chunks of tomatoes, garlic and fresh shrimp. Honestly, much better then the pasta I had last night at a so-called Italian place in Pacific heights (Via Veneto). The burger and fries are pretty good. 

Just a nice place to kick back and hang out on an afternoon.
author: Marcia B.

description:
I'm a new San Fran resident by way of NYC, Chicago and Boston.  I've been a pretty lifelong Sox fan so imagine my excitement when I stumbled upon The Connecticut Yankee in my own neighborhood.  

The Connecticut Yankee combines good things from Boston and Chicago that make me feel at home and comforted.  The bar is what it is...an old bar with a slightly run down look.  Don't come in expecting it to be some new polished club or bar with a scene...I don't think true Red Sox fans would stand for that.  But that is what my regular haunts in Chicago were...bars that didn't try too hard. 

The food was great  and they have a bunch of beer on tap and in bottles so you won't be disappointed.  The back patio looks really nice and fun and something I'll try out next time.

The bar lacks bigger TVs...if your game isn't on the main big screen, you'll need to move your seat closer to the other smaller TVs.  And when you stop by during a game, expect to wait a bit for your beer and food...but you're there to have a good time so don't get too pissed.

I just wish I found this bar as soon as I moved to Po Hill...the Sox better go far in the playoffs so I can enjoy the atmosphere there more.
author: Chris H.

description: This place has a cozy neighborhood non-douchebag sports bar feel. Great place to grub before a show at the BotH. Only the 2nd place in the city that I've found Poppy Jasper on tap. The nachos (with chicken) are actually pretty decent. All this, and I haven't even seen the much-ballyhooed patio yet!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
The hubby and I used to live on the Hill and have fond memories of this place: Many a weekend brunch was enjoyed on the patio back in the day, and many burgers and beers were consumed inside on nights when we didn't feel like cooking.

So when we found ourselves in the old neighborhood yesterday with hungry kids in tow, we stopped in for a bite and for old times' sake. Ugh -- what a disappointment. Admittedly, you don't come to a place like the CT Yankee for a fine dining experience. But the food should at least be satisfying -- and our meals were almost uniformly HORRIBLE. 

I had the "Larry Birdger," which was almost totally devoid of taste. If you have to salt your burger and drown it in ketchup to fool yourself into thinking you're eating something other than warm styrofoam, you know it's bad. The salad I ordered on the side had several disgustingly wilted pieces of lettuce mixed in (so wilted that they disintegrated and covered all the other pieces of lettuce with bits of slimy vileness), and the dressing was so watered down as to be -- you guessed it -- tasteless. My husband got the "Fowl Play" (fried chicken), which he said was also like eating cardboard. Our daughter had the chicken nuggets, which I sampled and which tasted like fried tennis balls. On the upside: Our son enjoyed his garlic steak sandwich (which I did not sample), and the fries were decent. Still, it was clear that just about everything came out of the freezer case at Costco, and was prepared with extreme apathy.

All in all, almost a total waste of the $70 or so the meal set us back. I know the place is a sports bar, but if you can't even get bar/diner food right, it's time to hang it up. I just don't think they care anymore.
author: Leah H.

description:
Why have I not been here before!!?! 
Mr. V suggested this spot after we browsed and drank and danced 
at Indie Mart which was hosted at nearby Parkside. 
I loved everything about the Indie Mart event, except the 
30min wait for food ordered from the kitchen. 
My only requests as we changed venues: 
A patio-so we could keep enjoying the lovely sunny day. 
A bar with(good) food items. 
I ordered another margarita, and we split the pulled pork sandwich 
while enjoying the sun in the patio outback. The sandwich was perfect! Slow roasted pork and a nice not too sweet, not too vinegar sauce. Other menu options include standard bar fare, grilled chicken salads and sandwiches. Fries, burgers and a nice offering of beers. 
The communal style picnic tables allow you to meet and converse with your neighbors. There is also enough space if you simply want to have a one-on-one conversation or make out session with your fave boy or girl. As the weather warms up this place is a great alternative to the too crowded Zeitgeist-if you're willing to make the trek. . . 

P.S. the 22 stops right outside, a plus for safe drinking :)
author: Kia B.

description:
Just had a really bad experience, I was sitting at the bar watching the Sox stick it to the Yankees, thoroughly enjoying it, when the guy next to me gets really belligerent. Nasty drunk belligerent. The kind that gives you two choices, bar fight or get out of there, so I got out of there. But on my way out, I told the waiter that the guy was getting out of control, and he told me that the nasty belligerent drunk was the owner! Now, I have no idea if he was just messing with me or what, but it wasn't much fun either way. 

At first glance it looked great, but I think there's something rotten there. Unwelcoming. I'm a pretty unassuming, quiet guy when I'm watching sports, so it's pretty strange when something like that happens to me. I'm with tiffany M., the people who work there are just a little off, and not in a good way.
author: Benjamin E.

description:
Cool, somewhat dirty and dark, neighborhood place.
Food is Awesome.
Good to come with a group and spend a few hours blabbing.

I love their food... seriously.  It rocks, even if it's a little pricey for a hamburger and fries.  Anyone who has grey-poupon like mustard with a killer burger is friggin' awesome.

When I first walked in, I thought I was in a dirty Texas bar... but the place warms up after you hang out a little.  Cool vintage sports paraphanalia - outdoor area is quite sweet.

This place attracts loyal customers - you wonder if they even have day-jobs... or night-jobs, or any jobs besides sopping up alcohol and hanging out.

But, still a nice place, come here to taste the food and soak it in - you'll probably love it or write it off if you are a Chanel poster-child.
author: Aaron T.

description: Yet another bar I've been to plenty of times and forgot to write a review about.  I never even noticed the outdoor seating before.  Good food, good bartenders and a great selection of beer.   Great place to watch a show or sports.  If you're into either of those things.
author: Corey V.

description: big shots, live music, hippyish crowd the night we went. cool place overall, wouldn't come back to party but would come back to chill.
author: Phuc B.

description: my girlfriend and I found this place while visiting SF from San Diego. we were looking for a nice Boston friendly bar to watch the Red Sox game when we can across this place. the place was packed with sox fans when we got there, but our server Bob told us we were more than welcome to share a table. we say down with a couple fellow sox fans and had drinks in our hands right away. my girlfriend and I both work in restaurants/bars, and I can assure you that the service is definitely on point. our visit happened during a Saturday night, but any time our drinks got low, Bob was right there with our next round, matter how busy he was.  the food was great (get the steal sandwich. you won't be disappointed) and everyone in the establishment was incredibly welcoming. we had such a great time that we came back the next night for game 5.  if you're going to SF, definitely give this place a visit and ask for Bob!
author: Jason S.

description: I have been to CY quite a few times and have enjoyed both the food and drink offerings every time. The Philly cheesesteak(I think it may be called the Dr. J???) is really good, but the real reason to go there is the Prime Rib on Saturday. It is not House of Prime Rib quality(what is) but it is pretty damn good,especially for the price. They have a good beer selection too. The one complaint would be that for a place with that many TV's, they sometimes aren't showing the big games unless you twist somebodys arm. Cool place though
author: Nick R.

description: Incredibly random place.  I have only been here for brunch as it is my bf's mainstay for brunch.  It is a dingy wooden bar that looks like it was teleported (currently obsessed with the idea of teleporting!) from the east coast with flat screens on every available wall playing a myriad of sporting events.  I was skeptical at first (read "Did you seriously bring me here?"), but the staff is very friendly and the brunch is delicious.
author: Stacy H.

description: Being from Boston, I was looking forward to finally watching a Patriots game at this bar. I had heard so much about its New England love. There was a big game on, so the bar was pretty crowded. That said, I was sitting right next to the bar and it still took 20 minutes to get a drink. The food was alright, typical bar food. The staff was extremely rude and the bill came on 4 separate pieces of paper so when we paid what looked like the the total we were chased after (all the way down the street) and were told that we were $200 off. Wonderful way to end a terrible visit to this bar. After the Pats lost the bartender cut us off and we were asked to leave. We were with a pretty large group of people, but were not causing any trouble or acting out. I was terribly disappointed and will most definitely never be returning. I've been treated better wearing a Patriots jersey in a New York bar.
author: Lauren P.

description:
I went to see a friend play at this place (Z-Trane Electric Band, check it out yo: Pier 23 March 19!) LOL.  Now that I have fulfilled my contractual obligations, on with the review. The place was small and crowded.  I didn't care to have anything eat, since it was already late and really I just went there to see my friend play.  Definitely had a New England feel to it.  Loved all the sports memorabilia  plastered on the wall.  Although some of the bartenders totally reminded me of "Moe" from the Simpsons (crass and repulsive), the rest of the folks there were pretty cool.   I just ordered my Guinness and sat the fuck down. Finding a seat was a bitch and half.  One server would tell me and my friend, "Oh yeah this table is available" and then before our ass cheeks touched the chairs, he would ask us to move because he needed to rearrange the table.  We went through this song and dance about 5 times.  Ugh, I take it that you haven't had pussy since pussy had you eh?

If you want to use their bathrooms I suggest you get a tetanus shot
and then get yourself check out after you leave since they might discover a new type of VD in you.  I held it until I arrived at the IHOP in UC.  I didn't want my uterus to fall out.  

The pros: My car was not stolen.

Would I come here just to get a drink? NO
Would I be as bold as to try their food? FUCK NO!
Would I come back here if Z-Trane Electric Band was playing? FUCK YES! THEY FUCKING ROCK.
author: Elle A.

description: Hell yeah Connecticut Yankee!  They have beer, great food, indoor outdoor dining, friendly staff, sports on the TV's, party rooms, clean bathrooms, and all you want from a sports bar/restaurant.  I love sitting in the back garden area and having lunch, salads are good, burger is great, and you can't beat the price.  Its a sports bar when you want it to be, a restaurant when you want it to be, and everything in between.  The bar tender makes a pretty kick ass home made hot sauce too...goes good with the chicken tenders or pork sandwich.
author: Ryan G.

description: Great Chowder, Good Burger, Heated Patio, Good Looking Menu, Lots o' Drinks. Great place to hang outside and get your grub & drink on! It just kinda stinks inside so  I'm not sure if I'd ever want to actually eat inside, tho.
author: Dina G.

description: F* this place and their bad F-ing attitude, bad food and smelly bathrooms.  Yes, I DO actually need a fork to eat dinner and yes, I'd like ketchup with my burger and fries.  I would also like a pitcher of coke and water since you never filled up either in the hour+ I was there with my friends.  New England blows goatballs anyways.
author: Chard M.

description: Ok so the morning after guys.. this is where my date( see serpentine, chez maman etc... yes he is doing REALLY good!) took me with some friends. Its a cute old school New England bar with a beautiful oak bar and cool outside dinning area. Think semi greasy spoon, good brek-ie and good salads, soups and sammies for lunch... I was supposed to perform here so im pretty sure they have live music... xoo until the next date ;)
author: Liz C.

description:
As a sports bar, it's a good sports bar. Not quite my thing.

Pro's
- Good beer selection
- Friendly servers, I liked both of them both times I've went. They have a nice air about them and make you feel at home.
- Easy to get a table and park

Cons:
- Cold. Seriously. Been here twice, and the girls both times complained and we changed tables just because it was cold.
- Food is just OK, i'd go here more if it was cheaper


A decent place to go watch the game etc. but not for a date or any exciting meal...
author: Brian E.

description: Cesar salad with as many anchovies as you like and a good pint of  beer on tab.  I can stop by here two or three times a year and be very happy that I did.  The neighborhood continues to change into yuppie land but I guess that can be said for the entire city.  I must be getting old because I do not like the changes.
author: ein bier bitte k.

description: The 3 stars is for the fact that they have Liberty on tap and a good grilled cheese.  Otherwise, the staff is usually rude, rude, rude...in particular the chunky lady who is the server in the early afternoons.  She goes completely out of her way to be rude.  The last time I ate there she was her usual impolite self and then when we asked her to split the check she charged both halves to my credit card.  There was not another soul in the place - it's not like she was slammed - she's just snarly.
author: Sarah Z.

description: Stumbled upon this great place while waiting for a band to come on at Bottom of the Hill. We wanted a quick bite, and me, being a foodie, skoffed at my boyfriend wanting to eat a bar. But boy was I wrong! Our waitress was awesome. I asked for a recommendation while my boyfriend made up his cheeseburger mind in 2 seconds flat. She mentioned a few things, but when I said, "what about the fried chicken?", her face lit up like an angel from above....and she said "PANTY DROPPER". Sold! It actually wasn't what I expected, but I loved it. It was a flattened breast, lightly friend with a Panko like crust. The "gravy" was on the whole plate AND on top of the chicken, mashed potatoes, and green beans, was ALFREDO sauce. But ya know what?? I was awesome. Brilliant actually. Simply divine and I would order it again even if my bum got a tad wider :-)
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Miss New England? Conneticut Yankee reminds me of an old school Bostonian local haunt, but its right in the middle of Potrero Hill. I visited I think on a Friday early evening; it was pretty sparse at the time, and one of the few dives I know that have a selection of food. Fried variety, perfect with their list of beers. Decent pricing, cool staffing, nice feel; I'm sure it would be fun to come here on a major game day...
author: Jessica L.

description: This is a great neighborhood bar with sports on during the day and live music at night.  It always has a good vibe but never feels too packed.  The bands have often been rock cover bands when I have gone, which is fun.  They clear out the tables so there is a dance floor area.  The food is standard bar food from what I could tell the one time I ate there.
author: Laura F.

description: Certainly feels like home... low on the hipsters and pretentious vibe that lots of SF bars exhibit. Beer selection was reasonable and the food was average but a place like this is more about the people. Definitely will be back on game day.
author: Scott T.

description: Shittiest service in the world. Not like I needed another reason to avoid this place, based on their team preference, but seriously-- terrible.
author: Cathy C.

description: One of the best turkey burgers in town! Plus, the bartenders are really friendly. I highly recommend stopping in for drinks and some food.
author: K A.

description: I don't even know where to begin. But they do deserve one star for the outdoor patio with heat lamps...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I think that the Yankee has the best fries EVER.  Remember how KFC used to have french fries (not wedges) that were crispy on the outside but soft in the middle?  These are like those except better!  The menu at this place is standard American food but made with care.  I like the patio if the weather is nice.  Full bar with beers on tap and sports games are always on.  I've also seen coffee shop rock type bands play there, by accident.  This is a staple in my hangover-need-french-fries-diet.
author: angela k.

description: I usually have ended up here before Bottom Of The Hill shows and it's really a pretty basic, and functional bar in the no-man's land it occupies.  The ambience and service are fine, I mean, it's a functional bar, and really all one can ask for in a good bar is cold beer, bucket shots and a solid burger and fries. They have em' all. It's nothing memorable, but, I suppose bars facilitate a certain fogginess to one's memory. So, all said, this lace is certainly  a good place to kill a couple of hours before heading to a show, or if you are waiting for a meth deal to go down under the freeway overpass.
author: brant f.

description: The Yankee's outdoor patio and inviting neighborhood feel are its two biggest strengths, but the live music, bar menu, and great beer selection can be just as good. Locals stop here on their way to Giants games and concerts around the corner (at Bottom of the Hill or Thee Parkside), but they end up here for the rest of the night, too.
author: Beau H.

description: I finally went here for the first time earlier this week to watch the NCAA championship. Great place to watch a game - plenty of TVs, good bar food (wings are in the top 5, although could be a little more crispy) and great beer selection. The crowd is totally laid back and it's not a scene at all. Staff is awesome - they're even cool with kids in the bar. They're even cool with kids drinking in the bar. Like 5-year olds. Hilarious. I look forward to going back and hanging on the patio in the sun, since Portrero weather does indeed rock.
author: Kate S.

description: Thank you, Yankee, for helping to cure my homesickness.  I moved to SF in the middle of last year's Series.  Death, thought I.  Not so, said the Yankee.  Not the same thing as being in Boston, of course, but you guys helped a lot.  Thanks for showing every game, all game.  And for the great service.  Go Sox!!
author: Sheila W.

description:
I had the displeasure of eating at the Connecticut Yankee last Saturday when someone in our group suggested it as an answer to our pleas for reasonably priced, abundant food.  The burger was fine, the fries were exceptional, but the place is absurdly over-priced, and they fricking skimped on the fries.  Who skips on flipping deep-fried potatoes?  What a stingy bunch of wankers.  

The thing that really got my goat though was that with the 8% tax, 18% mandatory gratuity (never mind that the waitress spilled my beer on me) and 5% "mandatory healthcare surcharge" you're looking at an extra third on your bill and have suddenly dropped a $20 bill for a mediocre burger, a handful of, i will confess, fairly tasty fries, and a single beer.  I'm never, ever going back again.
author: Matthew H.

description: After the tour I had today at anchor steam we decided to stop by at this Brewery since it was walking distance. I was pretty disappointed. We ordered a sandwich that did not taste very good and it was $10!!! WTF is that? Plus I don't like the location. THey need to definitely do something about the bathrooms..they don't know how to flush! I will never come back here!
author: Nir B.

description: This place is okay. If you live in the neighborhood you'll probably like it a lot more. The food is pretty standard. You could get the same in a diner. If you just want to come in, get a beer and watch the game this is probably the perfect spot for you. But, if you want a nice lunch with friends.....I'd say go somewhere else. I do like their burgers. They will cook it and make it exactly as you instruct. But, you will get an eye roll if you are super picky and prattle off all of these detailed instructions on how to prepare your burger. Trust me.
author: Jeanie G.

description: I love this place.  We have brunch there a couple of times a month, the food is fine, it's not fine dining but who cares when you're having breakfast at the pub?  The servers are great, and we always have a good time!
author: Emma C.

description: A great place to go for sports watching, breakfast, or lunch.  The menu is good, the service is quick and friendly. I really enjoyed the fries as well. I went last weekend and the breakfast specials looked so good it was difficult to decide! Definitely worth a try! Also nice to sit on the back patio on a sunny day.
author: Kaitlin O.

description: How disappointing! Ordered to go. Both sandwiches were not what they advertised. For the price we got skimpy sandwiches, the wrong bread, the wrong condiments. On the upside the fries are awesome as was the friendly staff.,
author: Kevin M.

description: Cool local spot for lunch.  We ended up sitting outside, and I'm glad we did (even though it was freezing) because when we walked inside the place smells like stale beer and I won't say what else otherwise I'll gag!  The sports memorabilia added a nice touch, along with the professional athlete named items on the menu.  I had the Bill Russell, which is a BLTA...really good and evenly proportioned.  The bacon was perfect, not to greasy.  Makes me wonder how the chose the athlete to accompany the food.  I wonder what they'd name Plaxico Burress after??  Hmmmm.....
author: N. Monique S.

description: I once went to the Connecticut Yankee and found an alcoholics anonymous meeting in the back room, and Immediately ordered a Guinness and a single malt.
author: Jon F.

description: I was surprised to find a place like this in potrero. went here with come co-workers for dinner on tuesday night, and all the dishes we ordered were excellent. The specials were off the wall, they had a variety of salads, soups, burgers, pastas, etc. A little on the expensive side, but the food was worth the price. It wasn't very crowded, which was nice. the waitress that served us was a little on the slow side, but other than that things were pretty good.
author: Casey Z.

description: Came here on a weeknight for some drinks and food.  It's a dive bar with a homely feel.  Had "Roger's Revenge" which is their famous Yankee nachos.  It was just ok.  I don't get how they decide on food names.  What does crab cakes have to do with Cal Ripkin or buffalo wings with OJ?
author: Naomi N.

description:
This is a cool spot with a chill bar and sports memorabilia, but be careful what you order. 

Fish and chips - Skip! Frozen is better. 
Meatball Sub! - Skip -- Seriously the $2.99 meatball sandwich at Subway is better. And Meatball sandwiches are not that difficult. 

Salty, bland sauce, and a couple firm to tough chewy meatballs. 

Soup of the day - cream of red pepper. That was good.
author: Mya P.

description: It's a bar.  A very bar-y bar with good burgers, good wings, and good beer.  I love the relaxed attitude and I love being surrounded by fellow Sox fans whenever a game is on.  It's so much more fun to hoot and cheer or curse at the tv when you're surrounded by your brethren than sitting by yourself at home.  The fact that the food is really quite tasty for bar food is a huge plus, but I'd still go just for a little slice of New England.
author: Martha S.

description: Awesome Beantown Bar.  As a Sox fan it's a must for me from April - October.  Cool staff (don't let the attempts at being gruff fool you), good tunes, Boston flair everywhere.  Great cheeseburger, lasagna, and good wings.  Outstanding fries and be sure to ask for Steve's hot sauce.  A must for Red Sox fans and for Giants fans pre-game.
author: T B.

description: I love this place! This is my husband and my Sunday ritual to go here and sit outside on the super cute patio. Their prices are super good and they have the BEST vegetarian burger in the entire city!
author: Agnetha M.

description: This place offers decent food and drinks and has a nice spacious patio.  A reliable spot for lunch when the weather is good, particularly for groups of 10+.
author: Suzanne K.

description: I REALLY Love this place. I don't really love too many places but for some reason I always say 'There's noplace like home' in my mind when I visit this bar. They make the best bloody marys complete with dilly beans and olives that are HUGE. The fries are outstanding...the chowda is palateable...I will not say it's the greatest. It sometimes tastes like they put sweet relish in it.??? The burgers are great...named after Larry Bird !!! The only thing I don't like is that there is a sandwich named after Bill Buckner (I hate that guy)!
author: Sherie R.

description: "I had a laid back lunch here and sat on the patio. Not the best food ever, but I can see the potential for a great bar! I would have enjoyed sitting out there all day with endless pitchers and good conversation!"
author: Lisa K.

description:
One of my best friends used to work and live near here ages ago so it was a bar I frequented for that reason only.  Somewhere along the line I started eating there or enjoying a drink on the patio while he wasn't working there.  This turned into a solid go to place for tasty reliable food and a decent beer selection.
My bf and I went there today and had a lovely meal outside--we mainly went because we happened to be in Potrero anyway and we were in the mood for good fries--which they definitely have.  He had the massive meatball sub which he liked better than the cheese steak and I had a chicken sandwich--yum.  We come here occasionally after a game or if we're in the area and it's always fun to sit on the patio and get wasted.
One star off because I've had hellish service in the past (although not recently)
Oh and another off because this is clearly a Red Sox lovin' establishment and they suck.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Alright, this ratings might be a little biased, but I'm a Red Sox fan.  The food is actually pretty good here.  I always get the burger here.  The calamari is pretty good as well.  The chicken fingers...well..it's alright, cause it's grilled instead of fried, but I'm sure some like it that way.  If you are a Red Sox or Pats fan, then this is the place to be.  Celtics..not as much I guess.  But bottom line, this is a great bar for Boston fans.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Been here many times.  The special open faced pork chop sandwhich is delicious.  Lemonade is tasty as well.  Yes I drank lemonade, non spiked!
author: Steve W.

description: I used to think that this place was alright.......... the outdoor patio does deserve some mention, but all things considered this place sucks. I want to like this place but I just can't.The food is lame and the service is worse. Do yourself a favor. Do not go here.
author: Ben S.

description:
where oh where is a fan of the two-time defending superbowl champions supposed to go to catch the game?  and what about the new england transfer who misses his sox?  to the connecticut yankee of course!  and while you are there watching your favorite boston sports time triumph over evil, be sure to order some of the cleverly named food items including:

the larry birdger
irving fryar's fingers
the veggie jackson
the ty cobb salad

two detractors from this new england sports fan's san francisco haven:

(1) the name of the place:  you should never make a red sox fan walk into a bar called the anything yankee to see a game

(2) the bar is kind of in the middle of nowhere...at least from my viewpoint high up in the tendernob.  not exactly clear to me how to get there with muni...pretty sure it involves a transfer...but then again...i'm not that smart.

GO SOX!!!
author: eric g.

description:
I love my Big Papi!  


If you don't know what I am referring to, you aren't a Red Sox fan and this review isn't for you.  They get 4 stars right off the bat for the Red Sow decor.  This is a good place to gather for a game.  Decent food and beer selection.  It didn't get overly crowded even during the World Series games so we could still get a table.  I would prefer it if the crowd were more rowdy.  There also seem to be too many "fan since '04" people since many of them didn't know the players and what was going on and had to keep asking my husband who was who since he is a wealth of all Red Sox related knowledge.  Honestly, I think that there are more intense fans at other bars in the city.   I have been there a couple of times and just found that it isn't "the place" to catch a Sox game even though the decor would suggest it.  I might go back again, but I would make it a "destination" like I do the Buccaneer for Pats games.
author: Kate B.

description: They should change the name of this place to "Boston Bar" or "Cheers the TV Show Bar" or "Norm's Stool Bar" or "The Sam Malone Bar" or "Good Will Hunting Bar" or "Matt Damon and Ben Afleck Bar" or just "Matt Damon's" or "Ben Afleck's" or "Sports Team's from New England Only Bar" or ...................... nuff said. Fun place to hang and feel like you're in New England, but can walk back into San Francisco. Yup..this is your own little New England Narnia.
author: Johnny C.

description: Food here is okay, but not excellent. A little overpriced for what you get. Only a good place if you're a Red Sox or Patriots fan.
author: Jason E.

description: One of my favorite places to catch a game.  Fun place to grab brunch before a Giants day game.  Great staff always ready to help you crack a smile by telling some off-center joke.  Back room has a big screen.  Cold beer, great bar food (burgers, fries, and don't forget the meatloaf!)  The outside seating is also a plus on a nice day.
author: Todd S.

description: Red sox games.  Good beer - Poppy Jasper amber ale.  Chill, low key atmosphere.  Excellent pub.
author: Janet S.

description: This is a great neighborhood pub, and the food is actually really good.  I work nearby and it's a perfect place to unwind with a few drinks, have the occasional dinner, and/or watch a game.  One of the regular bartenders (i.e., Nic) is one of my favorite bartenders in the city.  After a tough day it's great to come somewhere where you can park and have a friendly face that you know will take great care of you.
author: Cantik E.

description: I have been to CY several times in the past and liked it OK.  Two of us went last night, ordered one fried calamari appetizer, one hamburger and fries, one small salad nicoise and two pints of Anchor and the bill came to $55!!!!!  Never going back there ever again.  Outrageous!
author: Louise J.

description:
this is where i usually end up after my saturday morning softball games at jackson playground. 

they have an outdoor porch where you can drink and eat. it's family style seating, and it's a perfect place to devour your bruce hurst (eggs benedict) or dom dimaggio or yaz or any other plate named after a red sox legend.

what i like the most about this place is that they have yet to name anything after that scumbag roger clemens.

when they do, i'm out.
author: Steve T.

description: You could've had it. You really could have. 4 stars, so very within reach. And why not? Good beer selection, tasty food, nice outdoor space WITH heat lamps... and SO close to my band's rehearsal space. But you dropped the ball, Connecticut Yankee, damn you, by being a NEW ENGLAND SPORTS BAR!... Screw the Sox, I'm a Yankee fan, and I was DUPED by your regionally ambiguous name. So while the Larry Birdger WOULD be tasty, it's always gonna taste a little off to me. So chalk the Yankee up as a classic case of a tavern with tremendous upside, ruined by an inherent flaw.
author: Drew S.

description: Great outdoor space, especially for brunch on the weekends.  Inside is the classic sports bar, favoring all things Boston.  Food is above average.
author: Andrew R.

description:
the martini's are stiff, the heatlamps are soothing.
come one, come all.
author: Seiji C.

description: The food here is usually very good, and everyone's very nice.  I especially enjoy eating in the courtyard on a warm afternoon.  But I guess I'm just not into the sports pub thing, perhaps after being inundated with similar venues in my Midwestern past.  Nice place when I'm with the family, but fairly uncomfortable when I'm alone.
author: Casey S.

description: The people at CY are SO RUDE.  I politely asked our server if he could please bring a dessert for my coworker because it was his birthday.  He said "no, we don't do that."  I explained that it was OK and that I'd pay for a dessert if he would just bring it out so we could sing, etc.  He said "no, we don't do that."  He was such a rude jack-ass and I told him I would never be back there again because he was so rude to me.  He said something like "we don't care if you come back."  Unbelieveable!!!!!!!!
author: Brett B.

description: Wicked pissah!  Homw away from home for New England transplants.  The food is good, but a little pricey.  Bloody Marys get a spicy green bean garnish!  Come here for a Sox or a Pats game and you will see what the Yankee is all about!
author: Josiah B.

description: I used to like this place.  Nice old school feeling, good sports bar, decent (order simple stuff and you won't go too wrong) food, good beers on tap.  The questionable thing has always been the service, it's hit or miss.  They have some nice folks, and they have some old coots that think they can bully a female or someone who "isn't like them".  I've been barked at on more than one occaision by bartenders there. (as though they're doing me a favor by serving me), and last night REALLY pissed me off to the point where I decided to only have one beer, no food and not go back.  Not only was the bartender rude when I asked "do you have Anchor Christmas beer?" (they don't) but then when I ordered a regular Anchor on tap, he opens the cooler, takes out a pint that has been sitting there and serves it to me.  I give him a look, and he says "I poured it 2 minutes ago".  Then he puts one measly squirt of fresh beer in and demands $5.  I said.  "really?"  He repeats "I poured it 2 minutes ago - $5 please"  I paid him and drank the beer but I drink alot of beer and it was indeed kind of flat.  I didn't want to make an issue because I was there with a friend celebrating her birthday so I drank my quasi-flat beer and didn't tip at all.  Apparently the birthday girl's nachos were lousy as well, apparently they scrimped on the cheese.  Epic fail...
author: Priscilla C.

description:
THis place MIGHT be OK if you're a local to the hood....otherwise the hipsters/yuppies that work at this place won't give you the time of day!
Expensive taps, pricey menu, stinky kitchen! ( yup you can smell the sulfur(?) through the dirty restroom  walls/holes!) Plenty of other more inviting places to go , leave this place to the fat yuppie men and the art school boys...good luck finding a pretty girl in this dump!
author: Kevin G.

description: Excellent french onion soup. Pulled pork sandwich is delish.
author: che m.

description:
a co worker dragged me down here insisting they had the best burgers in the city.  and i have to admit, they were pretty damn good.  and they have a nice courtyard.

but when it comes down to it, this is just a very average tavern.  and i hate the red sox, so that doesn't add to the appeal for me.
author: Steve S.

description:
being a boston resident for 4.5 years, this place was like a sweet homecoming. a great locals bar with excellent beer on tap. closed a bit early for my taste (around 1) but the bartender was hella (excuse me, wicked) nice and the atmosphere was perfect for a relaxed, but drunk, night out with some friends. i especially like the fact that if someone walked in there in a suit and tie the band would probably stop. amen.

5$ shots, 4$ beers. i mean seriously, what more could you ask for.
author: David D.

description: Really good food here. I like it also because of the patio. I never knew it existed until the boy took me to lunch there a month ago. Great beer selection, funny menu descriptions and super friendly service. Bonus -it's near my office.  SCORE
author: Colleen B.

description: I had brunch there once. I thought it was very, very good. Enjoyed the patio.
author: ellen c.

description: I agree with Jessica M..."where have you been all my live?"  What a great place.  Whether you're an eater or a drinker, this place has it all.
